202217.name: The Streets of Commonville
202217.description:
From the publisher:

Commonville. A dangerous place to be. Especially since a callous murderer has gone into hiding within its maze of streets. With a warning given to police that if they don’t call off their manhunt within an hour, another innocent civilian will pay the price. It’s up to you and your team to discover which of the 12 suspects is the offender, where they are hiding, which weapon was used on the victim, and arrest him/her before the time runs out.

In this game, each member of the team gets to play as one of Commonville's finest, exploring the city, consisting of tiles. Each tile contains either a suspect, evidence that can be used to eliminate suspects, or something to assist you in solving the case in time.

During each round, each player will roll a varying amount of dice up to 3 times. You may then use the dice for movement (by matching the number on the destination tile), for gathering evidence (with any 4 consecutive dice), and for getting assistance (with any 3 matching dice). Donuts can be used to perform special dice actions (such as passing a die to another player). There is also a special blue Investigation die that can be used to perform actions rapidly (but only by the lead detective). After performing any actions, the team must move the time marker down a number of spaces equal to the number shown on the time die plus 1 minute for every wild 6 that was used for an action.

There are 12 possible suspects in the game. Once you have collected enough evidence to eliminate 11 of them (and found the weapon that was used on the last victim), you must collect an Arrest Warrant from the Police Precinct and arrest the remaining suspect. If you can do all of this before time runs out, the team wins the game.

202219.name: De Mol: Extra Vragensets
202219.description: Addition to base game, with five new packs of cards and notes sheets.

202220.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 188 - Apr 1991)
202220.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 188
April 1991 (note, masthead erroneously reads 1990)

Published as PDF in 2015

202221.name: Uzumaku Campaign
boardgamepublisher: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)
202221.description:
User summary
In the game of 渦巻くキャンペーン (Uzumaku Campaign), players are candidates for the next US President, and struggle to win the election.

There are four influence types: Popularity, Economy, Military, and Religion.

They go on a stumping tour to States such as New York, Florida, and Pennsylvania. In these States, they build influence of specific type, gain supporters spending influence, control votes per supporter, and obstruct opponents by negative campaigns.

At the end of game, number of votes is calculated according to number of supporters and votes per supporter ratio for each influence type, modified by undecided votes. The player with the greatest number of votes wins the election.

With little card text and no special powers, this gamers' game requires you to adopt various influence management tactics according to opponents' moves.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーが大統領選挙に出馬して、選挙を勝ち抜くゲームです。
ニューヨーク、フロリダやペンシルバニアといった都市を回って
サポーターを増やしながら、相手にネガティブキャンペーンを行い、
浮動票も獲得して勝利を目指します。
テキストや特殊能力はほぼありませんが、駆け引きとリスクがとても強いゲーマーズゲームです。

202223.description:
Be the first to run out of cards!

Zoop is a fun discard game in which the players must use their wits and skills to combine their animals and win the game. During their turn, players have to discard one card that shares at least two of the three characteristics — number of animals, color, and type of animal — of the last card played. Players can also use special cards that help them in their game.

The first player to run out of cards wins!
202223.name: Zoop
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

202227.description:
You are a German Industrialist competing with other German Industrialists in the creation of the newly invented railroads. Invest wisely in the creation and expansion of these railroads, accruing victory points in the process while reaping monetary dividends from your well considered decisions. German Rails lasts about an hour with 3 to 5 players, most Victory Points wins the game. Money is just a tool, albeit a very important tool in building the railroads of Germany!

German Rails is a reimplementation of Gulf, Mobile & Ohio on a German map. The dividend payments have been simplified to fixed $4 per share and there are less exceptions (Gulf, Mobile & Ohio had two-VP companies, which are not present here).
202227.name: German Rails
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8 - Back to School

202228.description:
Beaver Dam Creek is the fourth game in the Blood Before Richmond series, but the first battle chronologically.

The first major engagement of the Seven Days set the precedent for the fighting that would follow. You have a small contingent of Union soldiers occupying a strong defensive position; Lee's plan calls for multiple divisions to coordinate their assaults so as to outflank and destroy the enemy; one or two divisions do all the fighting, abandoning the plan and settling for costly frontal assaults. At least this time, Stonewall Jackson shows up - sort of, anyway: having just marched from the Valley with orders to attack the Union rear, he hears the fighting and promptly sets up camp instead, because of course he does.

The fourth game in our series goes back to the beginning. Though this battle has relatively few special rules, it's very challenging. It's much harder for the johnnies to activate more than a single division at a time, while the yankees find their line stretched precariously thin...
202228.name: Blood Before Richmond: Beaver Dam Creek
boardgamefamily: Blood Before Richmond: Battles of the Seven Days

202229.name: Dance 'Til Dawn (Game Chef Version)
202229.description:
From the game document:

Dance 'Til Dawn is a storytelling game that works best with four or more players (including the game master).

The game master, hereafter called the DJ, thinks of a
Scenario:

- The DJ programs a station.
- DJ determines the length of the Scenario.
- DJ reads Scenario aloud to the players.
- DJ distributes held singletons.
- Music starts, beginning Act 1. Players draw tiles.
- Second song starts, players bid for narrative control.
- Narration continues, with exceptions

User summary:

Play requires some Scrabble tiles and a stripped deck of French playing cards (that are defaced prior to play). A programmable sound stream device also is needed.

202230.name: Cold Fury
202230.description:
From the back cover:

Those who forget the past are doomed

Contained in this grimoire of ancient knowledge are quests that will lead those who dare to crumbling temples, labyrinthine tombs, sand-swept pyramids and dragon-haunted caverns. Here are demons and gremlins, ghosts and traitors, the ways and means to reach fabled islands and mayhap escape with your life. Will you rise up or be cast down to drown in the briny depths?


User summary:

Reprint of six adventures from out-of-print collection In From the Cold ("The Lone & Level Sands", "A Box of Old Bones", "The Unquiet Grave", "The Serpent's Venom", "Temple of the Lost God", "A Ballad of Times Past") plus Fury of the Deep (not previously available in print).

202231.name: Adventures of the Kai
202231.description:
From the introduction:

“The river rapids roar up ahead, threatening to dash your raft against the sharp rocks. Through the spray you can see that the river forks in two. To the left, you hear the cry of some terrible beast. To the right, you can make out the silhouette of River Pirates, waiting in ambush.

What do you do next?”

Welcome to Adventures of the Kai, three epic new adventures for you and your Players to embark upon! These adventures take the intrepid Kai Lords deep into the aptly named Wildlands, south to Ruanon in pursuit of fearsome bandits, and to Toran where they’ll need all their wits about them to solve a mysterious murder.

This book contains three new adventures:

For Richer, For Poorer – Guests of honour at a wedding, the Kai Lords must save the day when the groom is kidnapped by bandits! But as they give pursuit, they find out it might not be quite so straightforward as it seems…

River Pirates of the Dorn – A Sommlending expedition into the Wildlands has gone missing. The Kai Lords must trek deep into the wilderness to find out what has befallen it, in the process stumbling into the machinations of the ambitious River King!

On Wings of Darkness – A tragic chain of events is unleashed when the Kai Lords investigate a gruesome murder. They must hurry to halt a strange new supernatural foe before all of Sommerlund is imperilled.

But that’s not all, for the book also includes plenty of helpful advice for how to write an adventure of your own, as well as techniques and tips for what to do when things go awry!

202232.name: When Robots Dare to Dream
202232.description:
From the introduction:

When Robots Dare to Dream is a story game which explores the ethics of robotics and human dignity... It is meant for 3 to
5 players, although it is playable with two players with a few amendments. In this game, players are invited to sketch within three minutes a rough sketch of a situation, which is then used as fuel for the next scenes. The sketches from all the players, together with chosen twist cards, will answer the main question of the game: "Will the robotic dream of the sunlight become reality?"

202233.name: Stashed: Accumulated Treasures
202233.description:
Stashed - A Solitaire Card Game

The Story So Far...
You step inside your collection room to admire your lovingly collected treasures when you notice that instead of them being neatly organised into their trays they are scattered all over the place. Your precious items are in a mess and you need to get them sorted, luckily you have a system!

You have a deck of item cards that must be organised into designated spaces. If you can complete them all you win!

You also have some special actions that may be used to help you achieve your goal. Stashed is designed to be played by a single player, and can be played in around 15 mins. Co-operative variant rules are also included so you can play with a friend (or three)

202234.name: Draw Fortress
202234.description:
User summary:

Draw Fortress is played in phases. In the first phase, players collaboratively create a fortress by drawing defensive icons on a plot formed of concentric circles divided into zones. In the second phase various threats attack the fortress defenses and the players must respond to activate the defenses and protect the fortress.

202235.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil – Bane Super Villain
202235.description: The text of this oversized Super-Villain Character card reads "If the first card you play during each of your turns has cost 1 or greater, you may destroy it. If you do, +2 Power."

202237.name: Exosolar
202237.description:
From the introduction:

[The characters] are a group of solar powered robots, on a mission to colonize a distant exoplanet. [Their] goal is to survey the land and build a base to house future human colonists. Scans show that the planet is reasonably conducive to human life, despite orbiting a blue giant a star burning far brighter than our sun.

The journey from Earth was long but uneventful and [the] spaceship has landed safely on the alien soil. As [the characters] exit the craft, [their] radios fill with static. The radiation from the blue giant is interacting with the atmosphere in strange ways, making it impossible to communicate with fellow robots. Colonizing is going to be a lot harder than expected.

202238.description: The Outlaws expansion introduces 3 bandits to the Station Cards deck. These jerks spend a round robbing players of one of their dice if they happen to roll the train car the outlaw wants to rob! But to counter this, 6 new Station Cards are added and each has the passive U.S. Marshal ability to protect the player from the bandits. The bandits are smart enough to move on to easier prey.
202238.name: Trainmaker: Outlaws Mini Expansion

202239.name: Deep into the Hernduar Mine
202239.description:
Shake off the rust with your metal loving friends!

From the introduction:

Reaching a dwarven village whose economy relies solely on mining, the players are informed that the mine is temporarily closed due to a Rust Monster infestation. Will the adventurers accept the quest to clear out the Mine, and if so, how shiny will their armors be when they get out?

User summary:

For a party of four 4th level characters

202240.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – The Warp Unleashed
202240.description:
From the publisher:

“This world shall be my hunting grounds for all eternity, and your souls my prey.”
–Vha’shaelhur, Daemon Prince of Slaanesh

The Warp Unleashed is the final War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest.

A massive portal into the Warp has opened in the skies above Nectavus VI. Blood rains down, drenching the ground, and every drop holds a tiny piece of the Immaterium that will gradually overwhelm and possess the entire world. As the power of Chaos grows, distinct forces converge to destroy the servants of the Warp before they can utterly corrupt this world. Before they can triumph, however, these unlikely allies must fight their way through the Chaos warlord—a Daemon Prince of Slaanesh.

The Warp Unleashed is the sixth War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest, and as with the other War Packs in this cycle, you’ll find the focus on the terrifying Death World of Nectavus VI. Plenty of new cards with the Deep Strike keyword give you ways to surprise your opponent with unexpected tactics or reinforcements. Elite units continue to become more dangerous and viable for every faction, and finally, a new Chaos warlord invites you to call upon the Daemonic power of the Warp!

202241.description:
Adds a whole new group Heroes, as well as new Bosses and Tiles, adding new challenges and strategies to the game!

This set features 5 new Heroes eager to brave the Masmorra. Each of these Heroes comes with their figure, and hero board and cards featuring their unique abilities. Each of them also comes with an Arcadia Quest hero card, if you want to bring them into that game.

The Adventurers Set also introduces 2 brand new Bosses represented by tokens: Rhodus Mk1, the Mad Construct, and Gorka, the Orc Chieftain! And finally, this sets contains 2 brand new Medium Dungeon Tiles, one for Level I and one for Level II.
202241.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Adventurers Set

202242.description:
The Monsters Dice Set adds a whopping 12 new Monster Dice, as well as new Bosses and Tiles, and the much requested Dice Bags!

There are 8 copies of the new Minor Monsters Dice, adding Harpies, Gargoyles, Rust Insects, Kobolds, Zombies, and Dire Rats to the dungeons of Masmorra! There are also 4 copies of the Major Monster Dice that will bring more diversity to the second level of the dungeon, with the threat of Beastmen, Hydras, Death Knights, Lizards, Medusas, and Manticores!

These dice are mixed with those of the core box and drawn randomly when a tile requires a monster spawn of that given type. To help you out with the process of drawing random dice, and also to help store all your dice, this set comes with two custom Dice Bags, one for Minor Monsters, and another for Major Monsters!

But The Monsters Dice Set doesn't have only dice, it also features a couple of new Bosses, represented by tokens, to haunt your dungeon! Get ready to test your valour against Cun-Ha, the corrupted pharaoh, and Lord Blinkerton, the... whatever that thing is.
202242.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Monsters Dice Set

202243.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Luke, the Lucky
202243.description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy. Luke the Lucky, a young and enthusiastic Hero that will come with his figure, hero board and cards, as well as a Hero Card to play him in Arcadia Quest!

This exclusive Hero is based on Luke, the Rodney Smith's son from the Watch It Played Youtube channel.

202244.name: The Good Dinosaur: The Great River Adventure
202244.description:
Arlo, the young Apatosaur, and Spot, the lively human child, have been swept away by the big river. Can you guide them on their journey back home? Help Arlo and Spot on their adventures up the river. The player who receives the most river cards along the way will be the winner.

Each round, the Arlo & Spot standee is moved to the next river tile segment, which is flipped over. The picture on the tile indicates what challenge Arlo & Spot must overcome this turn; all players get a chance to participate in the challenges, which could involve throwing their character's 'stone' at a bad guy standee trying to knock it over, trying to throw their stones closest to a good guy, trying to get across the rapids first by rolling the two custom color dice and moving the characters matching the rolled colours one step further, etc. Whoever wins each challenge gets to keep that round's river tile.

When Arlo & Spot reach the end segment of the river, whoever has won the most river tiles is the winner!

boardgameintegration: Light of Dragons
Light of Dragons
202245.description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter a fascinating fantasy world in which mystical tribes are torn apart by internal strife. Fierce power struggles and cunning strategies lead to epic confrontations deciding who has total supremacy in the Warring Lands.

Roots of Mali is a remarkable challenge for strategists as players compete against each other with characters represented by dice – despite zero luck being involved! By vanquishing an opposing creature, you gain might points equal to the creature's power level. The first player to collect 10 might points wins, and you score by tactically moving creatures and exercising their special powers to outwit your opponent, eliminating their character dice from the board, which represents the Warring Lands.

Roots of Mali is a standalone game that can be combined with its predecessor Light of Dragons for new challenges and even greater replayability. Each tribe consists of six different creatures with unique abilities and distinct power levels. Tribes from both editions can easily be distinguished by the color of their representative dice.
202245.name: Roots of Mali
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 030b – Essen 2016
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 62: Wednesday, July 20th

202246.description: Thanks to the Cinderella setting cards and the new intriguing characters and magic items in Dark Tales: Cinderella, an expansion for Dark Tales, you will be able to experience different plots and surprising endings!
202246.name: Dark Tales: Cinderella

202247.description:
Star Realms: United is an expansion for Star Realms that's packaged in four non-random booster packs (Assault, Command, Missions and Heroes), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards and a rules card.

This pack includes the following cards:

- CEO Shaner
- Commodore Zhang
- Confessor Morris
- Hive Lord
- Chairman Haygan x2
- Chancellor Hartman x2
- Commander Klik x2
- Screecher x2
- "Heroes" rules card.
202247.name: Star Realms: United – Heroes
boardgamepodcastepisode: Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

202248.name: Disney Eye Found It!
202248.description:
A card game using the same art of Dreamworks Eye Found It, but with different rules, goals, and mechanics. The card show detailed illustrations on one side and a single item on the other. Each player receives a hand of 5 cards, then a card is drawn to determine the single item all players are trying to locate in their hand. The first player to find the required item gets to discard the card with the item.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all of their cards.

202249.name: Millennium Blades: Fusion (Promo Pack #3)
202249.description: Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #3 introduces two new playable characters to the game: Raritti, a master of card fusion, and Shafille, a CCG archaeologist.

202250.name: Millennium Blades: Final Bosses (Promo Pack #4)
202250.description: Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #4 consists of four new Master-level card sets, each themed around one of the bosses in the Cooperative mode of the Set Rotation expansion.

202251.name: Battle of the Penguins
202251.description:
It's the year 3001, the habitat of the Penguins reduced during the global warming and became very small. The Penguins evolved to less friendly animals and became truculent. Now every piece of ice is important to survive. Several clans fight for there lives. This game is played with two of those clans.

The aim of this game is to survive with as many penguins as possible, attack other penguins and nourishing your Inuit family.

Each player draws a card out a line of three open cards and that card indicates the actions you are allowed to perform. There are three types of actions. Lay down your tiles, move your penguins and attack other penguins. When you fight, you role dice!!
There are 10 types of tiles, most of them with a special effect to be carried out. So be careful where you place your tiles,
it could harm yourself!

Meanwhile you have to support your Inuit family, by slaughtering killer whales, seals and opponent penguins. Every fight will be rewarded whether it is successful or not. It's your effort that is rewarded.

202252.name: The Hell House Beckons
202252.description:
From The Back Cover:

"In the middle of a barren dustbowl is a manor. Tall and grey, it juts out of the infertile earth like a tombstone, marking the grave of hundreds. This manor is a place of evil; a place where tortured ghosts stalk the halls, and beneath its floorboards are the remnants of atrocities committed in the name of the devil"

"It is a place from Hell, and it must be cleansed"

This is the Ultimate Haunted House Adventure and Toolkit!

- Procedurally Generated Content

- Over 16 Random Tables

- 25+ Unique Ghosts and Monsters

- Over 50 Rooms of Spine-Tingling Terror

- Over 30 Custom Illustrations

- Compatible With Most d20-Based Roleplaying Games

202253.name: Klash
202253.description:
Each player has a character deck of cards and 3 lives (3 heart tokens). Players simultaneously flip their cards face up the fastest as possible in order to find a special Tech. There are some symbols printed on each Tech cards.

Players go on flipping cards up until they gather all the symbols in a specific order. The first player who does that Klashes his opponents with his Tech and a new round starts.

Most of the Tech cards have special powers that trigger when the Tech is achieved. In addition, each Tech grants points and the first player who scores 10 points wins the game.

If a player fails to achieve his Tech (i. e. they flipped the wrong symbol), he loses 1 life (heart token). When a player has no more life, he's out of the game.

This card game might be the fastest card game of the world!

202254.name: The Bird Told Me To Do It
202254.description:
Make sure your color birds show up the most on the branch and score big. Do what the birds tell you to do and score bigger!

The Bird Told Me To Do It is a point scoring game in which each player adds to a twisting forking tree branch from his hand of cards. Each card shows a number of birds of a certain color. A player can collect a plumage card of a color by adding birds to the branch in that color. When a branch is finished the color showing the most birds scores points for the player owning that color plumage.

Each card also shows an instruction being given by a bird on the card. When a player adds a card to the branch, he performs all instructions given on all cards on the branch from the trunk of the tree all the way out to the card he placed. These instructions can be to draw cards, collect plumage, score cards, add more cards to the branch, remove cards from the branch, or boost the effect of a future card.

Cards in the same color on the branch also boost each other's instructions. Chain lots of cards on a branch for crazy turns! Twist and loop the branch to keep other players from copying your moves!

202255.name: Prosperity: Planning Your Future
202255.description:
Prosperity: Planning Your Future looks like Monopoly on the surface, but is a much more sophisticated game intended to teach children the realities of earning a living and keeping the family solvent and safe. Each player starts by picking a profession at random, with salaries ranging from 120 pounds a month for a postman to 300 pounds a month for an actor.

Player tokens then proceed around the board with opportunities to make investments in either unit trusts (which pay triple at game end) or a house, to use hire-purchase to buy household appliances, to put money into or take it out of banks and building societies (paying 8%) or Local Council (10%), as well as to encounter Accidents or Unexpected Expenses and to buy a wide variety of Insurance Policies against such ills.

Purchasing a property requires a minimum deposit, surveyors fee and solicitors fee, as well as monthly repayments of about 1% of the mortgage amount. Passing Start provides monthly salary for the occupation less all monthly payments (rent or mortgage, insurance, hire-purchase). The winner is the first to accumulate total assets of 15,000 pounds.

This made-in-England game is undated, but the graphics point to late 1950s or early 1960s (the family father on the box is smoking a cigar and wearing a jacket with cravat). The box claims a copyright, but there is no indication of the copyright owner or publisher, with the possible exception of a small cathedral-like logo on all four sides of the box. The rules and play suggest it might have been produced by a company in the investment or insurance business.

202256.name: The Tempter
202256.description:
From the introduction:

The people of Orașnou are desperate. The village is on the brink of starvation and has little chance of surviving the harsh winter. Even if they had enough food and supplies, Lord Strahd’s taxes are due, and the ruler of Barovia does not accept excuses as payment. The Burgomaster and others in the village have recently learned of a wealthy estate that might have enough resources to solve both of Orașnou’s problems. It is a temptation he cannot afford to resist or can he?

Part Nine of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts

A Two-Hour Adventure for 5th-10th level Characters

202257.name: The Artifact
202257.description:
From the introduction:

An expedition to the Amber Temple reveals another major minion of the enemy and uncovers a secret weapon that may help defeat them.

Part Ten of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Four-Hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters

202258.name: The Donjon
202258.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Orașnou is panicked when a group of Bloodhand orcs appear at the edge of the woods. They bring news and an unusual request that reveals a new foe.

Part Eleven of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A 4-Hour Adventure for 5th-10th Level Characters

202259.name: Squaremino
202259.description:
The Squaremino board game is a challenging and addictive abstract game for 2-4 players that uses a unique set of domino-like tiles. Players take turns adding sets and sequences to a public network of tiles, attempting to be the first to play all of their tiles.

Players of various skill levels can all enjoy this game as more casual gamers will enjoy a relaxing social experience and more advanced players will enjoy exploring complex strategies. The game play is a blend of competition and cooperation as players pursue individual goals while jointly building upon a common structure.

The generously-sized game tiles feel delightful to the touch and are pleasing to the ear as they are shuffled together. As the game play progresses, beautiful patterns of colors emerge, creating an elegant work of art by game's end.

202260.name: Cthulhu Dark Grindhouse Edition
202260.description:
Designer's blurb:

In May I spent some time working on my own version of the Cthulhu Dark rules by Graham Walmsley. I really like these rules, but the one-page format always bothered me (ironically, I know). I had also never done a proper cut’n’paste kinda zine thingy before, so I resolved to catch two birds with one stone.

I typed up the text as first published in Stealing Cthulhu on my cheap-arse typewriter, cut it out, pasted it on a “master” and then proceeded to doodle all over it. I knew I wanted to give out copies to players whenever I get to play it, so I included a character sheet at the back. Graham kindly gave me permission to share the resulting abomination, so here it is for your own pleasure.

202261.name: The Remains of a Starless Night
rpg: The Remains of a Starless Night
202261.description:
From the introduction:

The Remains of a Starless Night is a storytelling game for two people, about lonely hearts in a broken world, the heat of a night in a technoir club and whispers between strangers. You can either play it as a regular roleplaying game at home, acting out the scenes describing the club and the environment in which the story takes place or you can play it out in a real club.

202262.name: Wham Krak Swish
202262.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wham Krak Swish is a simple combat add-on for The Black Hack and other OSR games.

It's easy to implement and even easier to play. Choose between twelves different combat styles. Make those fights more fun!

202263.name: Scorch
202263.description:
User summary:

Characters in Scorch are defined by Aspects (Engineer, Mechanic, Scavenger, and Wrecker) and Traits (Intelligence, Agility, Strength, Charisma, Perception, Endurance, Impair, and Luck). Aspects have an assigned numeric value from 1 to 3 that determine a dice pool for the Aspect. Action resolution uses the appropriate dice pool with some results counting as successes. The game master determines how many successes are required for a given action based on its complexity or difficulty. Characters also can possess "Sketches", a technological skill, trick, trait, or advantage, that yield bonus dice to certain actions.

202264.description: South Africa is a land with a rich history, demanding terrain and spectacular resources. 1859 stretches from Cape Town through the Orange Free State to Johannesburg and beyond to Rhodesia. Tokens are non-blocking but do extract a cost for passage. The later discovery of Diamond mines in Kimberley affect the play, as does the even later discovery of extensive Gold deposits in the Transvaal. The game requires the usage of the hex track tiles and play money found in Avalon-Hill's 1830. New Little Companies are provided. 1859 lasts from 2-4 hours and is for 3-5 players. This is not a game for beginners. Most money wins the game.
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8 - Back to School

202265.description: American Robber Barons look to exploit America's midwest in this collusive game of explosive railroad expansion in the late 1800s. Players start and expand railroads from Chicago to the Rocky Mountains. Money talks in this game of savvy decisions and smart execution, with dividends fueling further expansion. Shifting stockholder alliances focus on attaining more and more wealth for the stockholders. Self interest drives this game. Chicago & NorthWestern lasts about an hour, most money wins the game. This is not a friendly game.
202265.name: Chicago & NorthWestern
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8 - Back to School

202266.name: ZORP: Zombie Oblivion Response Pack
202266.description:
ZORP is a shoot-em-up strategy game that combines fast-paced action with chess-like strategic maneuvering and decision-making. It's easy to learn and has both recommended and randomized board arrangements.

One player is a zombie master who controls a steadily growing horde of zombies. Every other player is a human who has been infected by the zombie virus. Humans have nine turns to get to a cure. Along the way they will gather weapons and events to help them survive.

In a two/three player game, there is only one cure on the board and in a four player game there are two. This means that in a three/four person game, one human is always guaranteed to not get a cure. Humans will want to work together, at least somewhat in order to overcome the odds, but in the end, one person cannot be rescued, so humans may turn against each other to slow each other down.

Each human begins with one random weapon and their turns consist of two movement phases and an attack phase, which they can use in any order. (Move/Move/Attack, Attack/Move/Move, Move/Attack/Move) A movement is one tile in a non-diagonal direction and an attack lets you use all of the ammo at your disposal during the attack phase. Each weapon has different properties and the ammo is reloaded each turn.

When a human lands on a weapon tile, they add it to their inventory and are able to duel wield weapons. If they land on an event, they trigger it immediately. Some events persist throughout the game (like finding fast shoes, etc.) some are one time use (like finding a live grenade, etc.).

The Zombie Master's turn begins by moving all of the zombies on the board. Different zombie types have different movement abilities. After moving existing zombies, he/she spawns new zombies to add to the board. Certain turns will also trigger a zombie event after the new zombies have been placed on the board. Zombie events are generally good for the Zombie Master, but expert humans can find ways to exploit certain zombie events.

The players take turns until either all the cures have been acquired, or time runs out and none of the turns have been acquired or if the zombie master can zombify all the humans in the game.

202267.name: The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign
202267.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand City of Middelburg is a vast metropolis that is home to over a million souls... and one hellish demon. This hellion stalks the shadows to prey on the lives of men and feast on their very terror. This ruin of a man has come into the city like a thief in the night and now seems to rule it through fear, yet noone has ever lain eyes upon it and lived. The string of murders left behind in its wake grows more gruesome and horrific as the days tick by and yet there seems to be no end to what this monstrosity has planned for this once serene city. Can you survive the Ruined Man's machinations? Can you survive in a city that is tearing itself apart at the seams? Can you survive when all around you the people turn upon one another in paranoia and suspicion? Can you survive in the Ruined City?

The Ruined City is the first campaign released for The Runed Age setting and takes place in the Grand City of Middelburg as a series of gruesome murders happen and sends this metropolis of a million souls spiralling into panic, paranoia and darkness. The Ruined City is the first of four books in the greater Ruined Man campaign and serves to set up the main characters and events in the campaign, teach the players the unique campaign mechanics and puts them to the test to see if they have what it takes to survive in the dangerous city of Middelburg.


The City of Ruins

The Ruined City is not only an adventure and campaign book. This book also serves as a primer for the city itself. The Grand City of Middelburg was introduced in the Runed Age Corebook as a massive sprawling metropolis, home to a million people and ruled over by corrupt politicians and greedy merchants. Now the Ruined City will take you down onto the streets of Middelburg and show you all the places, buildings, monuments and areas of interest in each district of the city. The Ruined City alone will take you through a whole third of this gargantuan city with nearly a hundred unique locations visited and explored. By the end of the book you will know these parts of Middelburg better than you know your own hometown and you will be able to craft your own adventures and campaigns in and around Middelburg by drawing on the history and culture of the people and locations of these districts. But it isn't all dry reading. Each of the missions in the book is paired to the districts explored in that chapter, meaning that as you read and learn of these places, the campaign will take your through them as well so you can feel and experience them as any NPC in the world would.

The Path to Madness

The Ruined City contains four missions that will test your players to their very limits. Each mission is unique and seemingly separate, yet there is a thread underpinning it all: The Ruined Man. Each mission is as much noir mystery as it is an action adventure and it is up to the players to piece together the "whos", the "whats" and the "whys" of the Ruined Man before he utterly drives the city into madness. If the missions themselves are not enough of a challenge for your players, the Ruined City will show them how the city falls deeper into suspicion and despair the longer the campaign goes on by making it harder for folks to get along and having the desperate people of Middelburg turn to crime just to survive. Now not only do the players have to fulfil their obligations and complete the missions, but they have to do so with the whole city seemingly agains them.

202268.name: Amazon Warrior
202268.description:
From publisher blurb:

A common staple of fantasy fiction and mythology is the extremely athletic and skilled warrior who fights without armor and is stronger and faster than others. The Amazon (or Tribal more generically) Warrior is an attempt to address this sort of warrior for old school versions of the world's first and still most popular fantasy role-playing game.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert edition, and the cyclopedia edition.

202269.name: Headhunting Immortal
202269.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manual of Mutants & Monsters Headhunting Immortal for Mutants & Masterminds Rears its Head

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Headhunting Immortal, an offshoot of humanity that lives among mankind, hidden. They are reborn after their initial violent "death" to become incapable of dying. Unless their head is removed from their shoulders, that is. Caught up in a battle among their own kind, they fight until only one remains.

This product includes game statistics for the Headhunting Immortal, as well as ideas regarding how them introduce it to your game. Is your hero waiting to die merely to be reborn?

202270.name: Merchants #4
202270.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places - Merchants provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Common places Merchants #04' consists of maps and handouts of Surgeon's house which can be located in any fantasy town.

The set consists of:

top down view of the house;
basement map ( two versions)
ground floor map;
1st floor map;
a facade drawing of the house




Now it is up to You what secrets are kept in surgeons' house.

202271.description: Playmat designed for use with Superhero Solitaire featuring the heroine, Battery. To be given away at Origins 2016 to the player scoring the most during the Superhero Solitaire demo.
202271.name: Superhero Solitaire: Origins 2016 Battery Playmat

202272.name: Warbirds Space Age Sourcebook
202272.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has been 50 years since the Guild Pilots made their mark on the floating islands of Azure, and now they make their mark among the stars. Join in the fight against alien invaders to seek your fame and fortune in the Space Age.

With a fully updated setting, new rules for space age dogfighting, new customizations, new vehicles and even new races, Warbirds: Space Age is the perfect expansion to take your Warbirds sessions to a stellar level.

202273.name: Warbirds Jet Age Sourcebook
202273.description:
From publisher blurb:

The end of World War II marks the dawn of the Jet Age. Combat aircraft ride on plumes of fire and break the speed of sound. They launch missiles from impossible ranges and destroy their foes without ever meeting face-to-face.

Fly U.N. F-86 Sabres against MiG-15s in the skies over Korea, or have powerful US Navy F-4 Phantoms tangle with agile MiG-21s in Vietnam. Fast forward to the Digital Era and have NATO F-16s battle MiG-29s in the First Gulf War.

The Jet Age Sourcebook contains the stats for thirty famous aircraft spanning fifty years of history, as well as rules for electronic warfare, beyond visual range combat, and precision bombing.

202274.name: Remnants: Broken Lands II
202274.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remnants:Broken Lands II is the second expansion for the Remnants Role Playing Game.

Journey to the Broken Lands’ desolate south. Explore Wosaro Oasis, travel the Shattered Road, and risk the fury of the deep desert.

Inside you will find setting information, adventure hooks, NPC and monster stats, new optional rules, and brand new traits for your Battle Remnants.

In a broken land, in a broken future, fight for what’s left.

202275.name: BaRPG
202275.description:
Description from the designer:

BaRPG is the unholy result of a one-night stand between a drinking game and card based RPGs. From the side of RPG, BaRPG has inherited a melange of exciting characters to play, a definitely sexy level system, dice-rolling and booty (Err… I mean epic loot!). From drinking games, it has inherited a series of ridiculous games that will keep you drinking. Though in the end there will be a clear winner, we like to think the true prize is in the friends you will make along the way…

The game is played between 3 to 7 players. Each player receives a character card, and a level and damage tracking card. Every round all players (except whoever last levelled up) roll a dice, highest roll then checks if what was rolled is higher than their current level. If so, that player levels up, reads out their character's power (which is a drinking game), and the group then plays that game. At the end of the game, someone will have to take 'drinks' as well as take damage. The game then enters a market round, where players can 'buy' additional item cards. These item cards can be used at any time during the game, and can either assist players or thwart the efforts of others. The game then returns to a new round of dice rolling.

The first player to reach level 6 wins, and yes there is even an item that can be played against another player to put him/her back to level 1. There are in total 10 characters with associated games, and these characters will swap during the game as part of the item card mechanics. Additionally, losing a total of 4 'sober' (damage) points will also return the player to level 1, force them to change their character, and lose all accumulated items.

202276.name: Wakkawakka
202276.description:
Wakkawakka is a turnbased two Player game. The goal is to capture as many cherries (victory points) as possible. Therefore players move their adventurer token in a pacman styled labyrinth.
But just collecting cherries would be to easy. That's why each player also has a hunter to stop the enemy adventurer. Hunters cannot collect cherries, but when they capture the enemies adventurer it is reset to its starting position.

So players have to decide how to spend their 3 move actions each turn on their hunter or adventurer token.

The first player to collect 11 points wins the game.

202277.name: Druid of the Staff
202277.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Primal Spirits call out for a champion, so take up the mantle and become a Druid of the Staff with this Quick Build! Over 20 all-new powers at every level and a class-specific Paragon Path for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition can quickly turn your Druid into a shillelagh-swinging force of nature. Not only do these options expand your Controller repertoire in inventive new ways, from the dangerous choice of the Staff of Thorns to the devastating Ironwood Petrifaction, but they also include plant-themed Summoning powers from 1 to 29! Call forth a deadly Dread Blossom swarm, vex your enemies with a Shambling Mound, and even command the might of the Treants.

The strength of the trees themselves are in your hands. Try a Quick Build with Druid of the Staff today!

202278.name: Percussion Bard
202278.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Bards on the battlefield, tenacity is a virtue with this Quick Build! Those who believe that hammers and maces make the best percussion will find a brand-new Bardic Virtue for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition, over 20 all-new powers at every level, and a class-specific Paragon Path, ready to use in your campaign. Inspire your party with an Ascending Tempo, Strike a Chord with your enemies to manipulate them, and fight hard alongside your allies with a shout of All Together Now! From Level 1 to 30, you'll find plenty of new tricks to quickly make your Bard the musical master of the front lines.

Make some noise and rattle some bones with the Percussion Bard Quick Build today!

202279.name: Arcane Archer
202279.description:
From publisher blurb:

Show those haughty wizards what a real magic missile is and become an Arcane Archer with this Quick Build! Over 20 all-new powers at every level and a class-specific Paragon Path for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition can quickly turn your Ranger into a a powerhouse of arcane might: attacks include the deadly Black Arrow that never fails to return, the unpredictable Chromatic Arrow, or even the legendary Arrow of Death! Then, with the Arcane Archery Fighting Style, you can use that energy to imbue your shots with the most effective damage type for the situation again and again.

Let loose the power of magic in every shot. Try a Quick Build with the Arcane Archer today!

202280.name: Urban Seeker
202280.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city is alive and talking for those who seek it out with this Quick Build! Seekers of urban environments stalk the streets, and with this all-new Seeker's Bond for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition, 20 all-new powers at every level, and a class-specific Paragon Path, they're ready for anything. Trip up your foes with a Cobblestone Scatter, summon a distracting Plague of Rats, and even glide through solid walls with Citywalk. From Level 1 to 30, you'll find plenty of new abilities in combat and out to make your Seeker the master of the city.

Find your own path with the Urban Seeker Quick Build today!

202281.name: Time Psion
202281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let's do the time warp again with this Quick Build! Over 20 all-new time-bending powers at every level and a class-specific Paragon Path for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition can transform your Psion into a temporal force to be reckoned with, both past and present. Stop time in its tracks, skip ahead a round, prematurely age your enemies, and even summon yourself from the future! With the power of time on yourside, there's nothing you can't accomplish.

It's time for something new. Try a Quick Build with the Time Psion today!

202282.name: Animus Artificer
202282.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feel the spirit of battle with this Quick Build! Manipulate the lifeblood of your allies and enemies with this Artificer build for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition, with over 20 all-new powers at every level and a class-specific Paragon Path, ready to use in your campaign. Let your allies Spring to Life, grant them a Dancing Weapon, and even unleash the terrifying Animus Titan! From Level 1 to 30, you'll find new artifices and new spells to turn the tide of battle.

Spill some blood with the Animus Artificer Quick Build today!

202283.name: Avian Druid
202283.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sky is the limit with this Quick Build! Harness the primal spirits of majestic birds with this Druid build for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition, with over 20 all-new powers at every level and a class-specific Paragon Path, ready to use in your campaign. Conjure a gale with Wings Spread Wide, snatch up enemies in your Iron Talons, and even summon the legendary Thunderbird! From Level 1 to 30, you'll find new spells and beastly powers to sweep your foes off their feet.

Take to the air with the Avian Druid Quick Build today!

202284.name: After the Sock Hop
202284.description:
User summary:

The game is set in 1959 in Moosejaw, Saskatchewan. Characters have a narrative description (samples are The Big Feller, The Charmer, or The Oddball). Actions in the game are divided into three types (physical, mental, or social). Various character descriptions yield a bonus on a certain action type. Also, bonuses are available for narrative descriptions. Action resolution uses a modified die roll against an "Intensity Rating" (difficulty rating).

202285.name: Hooligans
202285.description:
From the introduction:

Stupid, wild, hedonistic, and chaotic; goblins are everything man wishes to move beyond. While man can be said to constantly advance and move upwards and forwards, goblins are akin to pigs - content to wallow in mud and filth. Nature was not kind to goblins; they breed like rabbits, have lifespans slightly above a small dog, and explode when exposed to sunlight. Nevertheless, goblins can always be found on the fringes of society, surviving on the cast-off refuse of mankind.

An ancient pact keeps goblins from getting too much underfoot. One night a year humans lock their doors, board up their windows, and allow the goblins to run amok with no consequence. This wild night is the highlight of a goblin’s year, and each crew spends the months leading up to it picking the perfect location, planning glorious acts of recklessness, and scheming to seize the most choice of treasures from the world of man.

Night has fallen. The Van is in perfect running condition, or as good as a van built by goblins can be. The world stretches before you, young goblins. Run wild!

202286.name: Crisis
202286.description:
From the publisher:

Crisis is a modern game with many innovations like a virtual, generic map, no general certificate or money limits, rounds instead of operating rounds and stock rounds, structure purchases, and signals but without some traditional elements like off-board connections, terrain difficulties, small cities, empty big cities, or privates. This gives the game a new feeling already on the surface. Square tiles are used to simulate subways in a downtown megalopolis.

While once 1830 could be called the premier game of stock manipulation and 1841 is the game with the greatest speed of technological development, now Crisis is the toughest, most complex, and most unpredictable game of business strategy. Measuring complexity is hard but years of testing have produced counter-strategies for every strategy and not enabled me to foresee just one round, what is possible in 1830 or 1841.

So what makes Crisis so tough? First of all, companies can purchase unlimited numbers of foreign shares. This creates complex combines. Second, companies are forced to own more and more foreign shares, what makes good shares scarce. This is an extra duty besides buying a train. Third, foreign assets may only be bought from the or as a director. Fourth, all shareholders can be responsible for under-endowed companies while some might avoid supports and let the director lose his shares even though having supported. Fifth, other shares in such companies may not be given away and can cause more supports. Sixth, half the companies have only certificates that already allow a director change. Seventh, trading many old or new certificates quickly restructures combines, depletes companies, or inflates money. Eighth, the stock market and the round order, which involves players and companies, are particularly flexible. To conclude, dividends are paid only to owned foreign shares.

While the game has a balanced start and good route construction remains important, it becomes more and more essential to excel at wheeling and dealing. Clearly, Crisis is the game of devious business manipulations.

202287.name: Without Sun
202287.description:
User Summary:

Characters in the game have two Attributes named Sunlight, with a score running from 0 (essentially, dead - or at least completely non-biological) to 6; and Humanity, running 0 to 10. Throughout the game players must balance their Attribute values with desired outcomes. Characters also have a variety of narrative Traits as well as a presumably large number of cybernetic implants.

Action resolution uses a dice pool method that yields a number of successes; multiple successes indicates correspondingly better outcomes.

The game is presented in Microsoft "Sway", an online, interactive (semi-animated) presentation framework. Refer to web link in this entry for the portal entry URL.

202288.description:
Medici: The Card Game is a new design by Reiner Knizia that shares the setting and feel of the classic Medici board game, without using that game's auction mechanisms.

In 15th century Florence, players try to acquire the most valuable goods for their merchant ships by drawing 1-3 cards from a common deck each turn. After drawing, the active player must take the final card they drew and may select one or both of the previous two cards drawn (if available). They then load these commodity cards on their boat. Cards that are not taken remain available to future players. Once a player's boat is full (seven cards with two players, five cards with 3-6 players), they are out of the round and the day is scored.

Players score points for the value of their ships' holds, but also for the number of commodities of each type that they have stored in their warehouse. The highest earning merchant over three days wins the game. Some cards do not take up space on ships, while others contribute to the value of a hold, but cannot be stored in warehouses.

This is the first game to be added to the Medici family of games since Strozzi, released in 2008.
202288.name: Medici: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 6: The one about Halloween, roaming mechs, and the power of hype

202289.name: Ka-Pow! (Vol 1 No 1 - June 2016)
202289.description:
Ka-Pow!
Volume 1, Number 1
June 2016

Shadowrun For Risus!
Read All About It!

202290.name: The Uncle Who Works for Nintendo
202290.description:
User Summary

A Twine horror game created by Michael Lutz (author of My Father's Long, Long Legs).

The Uncle Who Works for Nintendo is a Twine horror game featuring multiple endings. You play an eleven year old who is spending the night at a friend's house. As the night continues, it becomes increasingly clear that something is not right...

Playable online for free.

202291.name: Far From Home
202291.description:
From the introduction:

In Far from Home, characters are called Saviors. They roam the universe in search of hubs, massive cities once built by humans, to reactivate the lost technology they contain and bring back the light in humanity deceased empire. Most of these hubs are now shadows of their former self, only housing a few humans in their machine bodies and their robotic helpers to maintain the knowledge and glory of humanity. When meeting a Savior, humans generally react favorably, seeing them as the hope they couldn’t find centuries ago. They still see them as weird creatures though, for people who lived millennia in their machines bodies, such a flesh and blood creature is frightening.

202292.name: Forgotten Stars
202292.description:
From the introduction:

Forgotten Stars is a game of memories, consciousness, and creeping existential dread. You will play the parts of the recorded minds of a number of characters. They have been sent on a mission, a mission they currently have no recollection of. Their mode of travel was a vessel where their minds were transferred into the computer systems of the vessel their bodies travel on. Their bodies have been kept alive, but without the activity of their minds. This process leads to memory degradation, in order to combat this their minds have been "awakened" and are inhabiting virtual representations of themselves having a discussion in a virtual room. They will each be provided a book of sketches that have been prepared for them to trigger memories.

User summary:

Utilizes Before the Storm game mechanics, though the needed rules are presented in this document.

202293.name: Reach | Escape
202293.description:
Author's blurb:

In REACH│ESCAPE, you have chosen to begin to walk the path of a Tracer. You reject the uniformity and conformity of modern society and have begun to dig deep back to humanity’s roots to rediscover what it is that humans have evolved to do. While playing, you will utilize all the skills that your body was made to do – balancing, crawling, running, rolling, climbing, vaulting, jumping, rough housing – to avoid the cameras and security systems that expect you to take the most obvious routes to and from your Contract.

202294.name: Steampunk Uprising
202294.description:
From the introduction:

Characters are students at an elite academy. Le Academie de Arte is renowned for its well-rounded curriculum, embracing the integration of science, technology, engineering, the arts and mathematics ("STEAM"), among other disciplines. Students are taught to stretch the bounds of what is traditionally thought of as "the arts" by finding innovative ways to integrate the arts with other disciplines. Le Academie students are smart, talented, and eccentric. The faculty members of Le Academie are among the best academics in the world.

202295.name: Beautifully Mutilated
202295.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined by Species, Attributes, Class, and Skills. Characters also own and accumulate equipment. There are three primary Species in the game: Humans, Wąż, and Slicks.

Each character has three attributes – Body, Mind, and Spirit. Attributes have a numeric rating indicating how well or how poorly a character performs in tasks using that attribute.

Characters have one or more Skills. These are limited areas in which a character is exceptionally capable. A Skill may encompass any functional area that the players agree upon. When a Skill is used, it must be appropriate to the task. A Skill will add its modifier to the Ability modifier for the dice roll.

202296.description:
Description from the publisher:

The wizard students are in trouble! It's long past bedtime, but they sneaked out of the wizards' school to visit the secret midnight market and see the flying brooms and talking cats they heard the grown-ups talk about. Unfortunately they don't get far for while crossing the forest near the wizards' school, Willy the Warden Ghost takes up their trail. Now they have to double back quickly or they are facing detention. But the forest is too dark to find the way back without help. Luckily they have an idea: The Lumies, magical glowing creatures that live in the forest, can light their way back to the school. The wizard students need to stick together to find the Lumies and make it back to the school before Willy catches one of them.

While escaping the Warden Ghost in Wizardry to the power of three, players need to work together, memorize the tree tiles, and use their magic potions and dice enchantments at the right time to make it back without being caught and win as a team.
202296.name: Wizardry to the power of three
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 75 - Essen Spiel ‘16 Live Report
The Game Pit: Episode 76 - Picking Over the Bones Family Edition

202297.name: Sunblink
202297.description:
From the introduction:

Moments are pieces of history, broken and scattered throughout time. The [characters] are able to preview these Moments and use the Sunblink cells to record them permanently. Each Moment is an instance of innovation and is coded with the region and era of its origin. Some Moments are more difficult to recover than others. Moments from the same region and era are more significant findings. Each researcher wants to build the most significant portfolio of recovered Moments and are even willing to steal for the distinction.

User summary:

The game is played as a traditional card game using custom cards; role-playing elements include the character actions and various player decisions about how to assemble a narrative from components dictated by card play. The custom cards are distributed as separate files intended for print-and-play.

202298.name: Sunblink:  Cards
202298.description:
User summary:

Sunblink uses two decks of custom cards and sets of custom tokens. These cards and tokens are provided as three black-and-white PDF documents intended for print-and-play use (although the page size used is unusual). The documents are:

- Moment Cards (12-pages; 1 page of 9 backs; 11 pages of 9 fronts)
- Code Cards (12-pages; 1 page of 9 backs; 11 pages of 9 fronts)
- Tokens (4-pages of 42 tokens)

202299.name: Machines Do Not Understand Dance
202299.description:
User summary:

This avant-garde game definitely pushes the boundaries of experimental role-playing. It is presented as a computer program (ironically, with a defect which quickly was pointed out by a reviewer) that simulates what a human dance might be like in computer code (via object manipulation). While the code could theoretically be compiled and executed, the rationale behind the game presentation is to allow an atypical introspection on the nature of gaming, technology, and, perhaps, dancing.

202300.name: 10 Days Without Sunlight
202300.description: Play the role of an android that’s about to die. The goal is to raise your android’s post-sentient research value by maximizing its philosophical insight before your alarm goes off and your android powers down forever from a lack of solar energy. Download for free: https://gamesandstuffbyjulien.wordpress.com/games/

202301.name: The Sickle Glitters
202301.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by traits. Play creates custom card artifacts (on blank index cards) that are used throughout the game. The setting of the game is co-opted from a specific historical period, incorporated by reference to a Wikipedia article.

The game was published as a series of tweets, none of which were edited. This process adhered to the Game Chef 2014 theme of "the unbound book". After the final tweet comprising the game was made, the author produced a storify version to place the tweets in a specific non-chronological order to enhance accessibility.

boardgameintegration: Platoon Commander: India-Pakistan War 1965
Sticks and Stones
Platoon Commander: India-Pakistan War 1965
Sticks and Stones
202302.description:
The first historical Platoon Commander module delves into the dynamic early days of the Korean War. The North Korean People's Army (NKPA) is relentlessly marching south, and the United States Army, vastly outnumbered, finds itself fighting a series of desperate battles in an attempt to buy enough time for the Pusan Perimeter to be finished. Chaffees and T-34s, Skyraiders and guerilla attacks; it's all here.

Platoon Commander: Korea 1950 features four tense scenarios:

Task Force Smith: The NKPA armor shrug off everything the Americans threw at them. Can they survive?

Taejon: The 21st Infantry Regiment & 78th Heavy Tank are all that stands between the NKPA and the unfinished Pusan Perimeter.

Chochiwon: The 21st Infantry Regiment faces ten-to-one odds. But US airpower might even the score.

Task Force Lynch: The daring Pusan Perimeter Breakout.
202302.name: Platoon Commander: Korea 1950

202303.name: Western Front
202303.description:
Western Front is a two player card game where players assume the role of commanders in the armies of the Kaiser's Germany, or the Entente Powers.

Battles are fought over 5 rounds representing the years 1914-1918 and the first player to achieve 3 years (rounds) is the winner.

Cards represent units and can provide attack or defensive values. Each player reveals their units simultaneously to determine net results before the option of playing additional cards. Committing units to the fight and employing sound tactical decisions will help achieve victory, however unpredictable events can dramatically alter the battlefield.

The game is said to have simple rules, allow for interesting decisions and be both quick and fun.

202304.name: Croix-Rouge cartes à jouer
202304.description:
This game based on UNO, was given for free to blood donors in Belgium.

The objective of the game is to be the first to empty their hands.
In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching the previous card color, number or symbol. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit:

Card "+1" / "+2"
Card "Invert"
Card "Skip turn"
Card "Change color"




Ce jeu basé sur UNO, était donner gratuitement aux donneurs de sang en Belgique

L'objectif du jeu est d'être le premier à se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes. Chacun son tour, les joueurs tentent de jouer une de leur cartes en correspondant à la couleur, le numéro ou symbole de la carte précédente. Si le joueur ne peut pas jouer, il doit prendre une carte de la pioche, et s'il ne peut toujours pas jouer, il passe son tour. Des cartes spéciales rendent le jeu plus intéressant :

Carte "+1" / "+2"
Carte "Inversion"
Carte "Passer son tour"
Carte "Changer de couleur"

202305.description:
Expansion for Massive Darkness containing:

6 Troglodyte Brute Minions
1 Troglodyte Brute Boss
1 Troglodyte Agent
12 Troglodyte Warrior Minions
1 Troglodyte Warrior Boss
1 Bloodseeker Minotaur
202305.name: Massive Darkness: Enemy Box – Troglodytes

202306.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are multifunctional God cards too. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but you can move forward 2000 years and time-travel to Rotterdam by the Gotthard Base tunnel for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
202306.name: Roman Italy (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

202307.description:
Includes all unlocked exclusive Stretch Goal content from "Apex TDBG: Stomping Grounds Expansion" Kickstarter campaign.

45 cards total come with :

New types of environment
Super Volcano Eruption

New types of prey to hunt
Dreadnoughtus, Agustinia, Mammuthus, Sauropelta

New types of carnivores
Dilophosaurus, Dimetrodon

New boss & minions
Titanoceratops

Alternative solo experience - "The Stomping Dead"
Brutal Environment
Rising of the Dead
Dawn of the Stomping Dead (an alternate Extinction Event)

Zombified Affliction
Infestor Parasite

The Infected
Devourer, Ghoul, Ravager, Summoner

An arsenal of Minions
Corruptor

A deadly Boss
Patriarch

This mini-expansion was designed to be the hardest solo experience Apex will ever offer (in terms of getting high victory points). Will you be able to survive the Stomping Dead?
202307.name: Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Second Kickstarter Stretch Goal Pack

202308.name: The Verdant Lord
202308.description:
From publisher blurb:

June, the official month of summer. We are celebrating with a special June issue of the Player Paraphernalia that presents a hybrid class focusing on nature and the powers exalted this season of growth and regeneration. The verdant lord takes the powers of the druid and marries it to the spontaneous spell-casting and bloodlines of the sorcerer. In addition a new feat is provided, specifically designed for the verdant lord. And not to be out-shown, we also provide seven new bloodlines that work well with this class but can easily be used for the sorcerer class as well.

202309.name: The Dragon Shaman: Heroic-Tier Playtest Build
202309.description:
From publisher blurb:

Breathe some fire with an all-new in-development Shaman build, the Dragon Shaman! This free playtest gives you access to a new Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition Shaman build that transforms your spirit companion into a fierce wyrmling, standing at your side as you wade into battle with draconic power. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Dragon Shaman build, coming soon!

202310.name: Paladin's Squire: Heroic-Tier Playtest Build
202310.description:
From publisher blurb:

Join the side of righteousness with an all-new in-development Paladin build, the Inspiring Paladin! This free playtest gives you access to a new Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition Paladin build that grants your holy knight a Squire, a customizable ally that assists your Paladin in the defense of the weak. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Inspiring Paladin build, coming soon!

202311.name: The Dread Necromancer: Heroic Tier Playtest Class
202311.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raise some hell with an all-new in-development Dungeons and Dragons class, the Dread Necromancer! This free playtest gives you access to a unique 4th Edition Controller class, using motes of shadow power to empower its attacks and commanding undead companions (including resurrected enemies!) to harry the living. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Dread Necromancer, coming soon!

202312.name: The Hexblade: Heroic-Tier Playtest Class
202312.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give the powers of luck and fortune a spin with an all-new in-development Dungeons and Dragons class, the Hexblade! This free playtest gives you access to a 4th Edition Defender class that rolls the dice... and then tilts them in its favor with a variety of arcane manipulation powers. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Hextblade, coming soon!

202313.name: The Scribe: Heroic-Tier Playtest Class
202313.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speak lost words of the arcane with an all-new in-development Dungeons and Dragons class, the Scribe! This free playtest gives you access to a 4th Edition Leader class that plays like no other, crafting glyphs and sigils that create zones of magical power that give your allies the edge. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Scribe, coming soon!

202314.name: The Trap Rogue: Heroic-Tier Playtest Build
202314.description:
From publisher blurb:

They'll never know what hit them with this all-new in-development Rogue build, the Trapper! This free playtest gives you access to a new Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition Rogue build that allows your character to design and build traps and devices to catch your enemies unaware. Then, be a part of the development process: send us your feedback and we'll incorporate it into the full Level 1-30 Trap Rogue build, coming soon!

202316.name: Lab Wars: Collective Power
202316.description:
Promo Card given out to players at UKGE 2016.

'Gain an extra 4 impact points if you build 15 lab items in your lab area.'

202317.name: The Haunted Cave
202317.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a cave at the base of a tall cliff several hours inland from the shore lies the treasure of a once famous pirate, Martyn Whiteskull. The exact location of the treasure is unknown but whenever a piece washes down the river to the village of Frokow, Martyn’s ghost appears to torment those in possession of it. In addition to being haunted by Martyn’s ghost, the cave is now the den of a pack of wolves that have lived there for decades and don’t like intruders.

Born the son of a successful merchant family, Martyn Karnak suffered from partial albinism that left the skin on his face and neck a pale white and his eyes read. This combined with the lack of hair on his body gave him an appearance that did not work well in the merchant community. Leaving that life, he eventually ended up a pirate where he was known as Martyn Whiteskull. Moderately successful, he lost his life in the process of hiding a portion of his treasure and his ghost haunts the treasure to this day.

202318.name: Borderlands 3
202318.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

The sequel to Borderlands 2.

202319.name: Adapt
202319.description:
Adapt is a highly strategic survival card game where you take on not only the environment, but your closest friends. Players take turns facing challenges on the island, exploring, hunting, and deciding when to betray the other players all while they are hunting down the precious relics to win the game. You can avoid dangerous misadventures by collecting and holding onto the right supplies, like the fanny pack!

At the beginning of each player's turn, they must draw an action card that they must play..the island gives them no choice! Players then take turns rolling a 4-sided die for the actions they can perform. During their turn they can choose from 5 different actions: Gathering, Exploring, Stealing, Attacking, or playing a card's action from their hand! To perform these actions, the player must roll the 20-sided die and get a 10 or higher (for attacking, gathering, or exploring) to be successful, or a 15 or higher for stealing! As the game progresses, the players must collect all three relics and keep hold of all 3 to win! It's either holding the relics, or be the last survivor standing.

202320.description:
The 6 Clans of Strike Island were... Bored. Because of the boredom, fighting broke out and chaos ensued. The elders of the clans got so piffed from kissing booboos all the time that they decided to do something about it. They would hold a contest with each clan's best warriors...

In Shadow Strike, you take control of a small group of ninja warriors; trying to be the last ninjas standing on the map. You will fight using each ninja's personal inventory, consisting of Shuriken, Smoke Bombs, and... Candy Bars. Throughout the game you will gain access to better equipment for you ninjas, such as Swords and Grappling Hooks. You will also earn precious action cards that will really screw over your enemies.

Shadow Strike mainly focuses on movement tactics on a hexagon board, as well as dice rolling and "take that" card play. Once only your ninjas are on the board, you win!
202320.name: Shadow Strike: Ninja Combat Game

202321.name: Monopoly: World Football Stars
202321.description: Do you have what it takes to be a football legend? Prove that you are the world's number one with the World Football Stars edition of Monopoly. Challenge friends and opponents to bidding wars for your favourite players from the world of football including Messi, Rooney and Neymar Jr! So what are you waiting for, reach for glory and become the football Monopoly champion!

202322.name: KISS Rock Band Monopoly
202322.description:
Get ready to rock ‘n’ roll… the dice! Take a rock pilgrimage through KISS’ rise to fame, with hit singles, platinum albums and sell-out live shows all up for grabs! Tour the board from their early years through to international superstardom using 6 customised heavy metal tokens! Whether you prefer to rock and roll all night or party every day, there’s only room at the top for one!

KISS meets monopoly
Visit KISS' history of hit singles, platinum albums and sell-out live shows!
6 customised heavy metal tokens included

202323.name: Dragon Monopoly Junior
202323.description: Join Hiccup and his friends on a new journey with Monopoly Junior to become the best Dragon Trainer in Berk! Collect dragons using sheep and build your Dragon Training Arenas as you go. Don't forget to look out for the Dragon Training Tips on the way!

202324.name: Le Prochain Raid
202324.description:
From the introduction:

The campaign always lasts seven nights and seven days. The game master needs to keep a count of the number of night and day phases played to determine if a raid occurs during a phase and to end the campaign.

The game ends on the seventh day. After determining where the bombs exploded on the seventh night, NPCs should tell the characters that a portion of the inhabitants have decided to try to evacuate the city and cross the desert. Ask each player why his or her character joins the voyage or remains to continue the defense of the city. If all characters do not make the same decision, the game ends with a farewell scene. Otherwise, end the game on a scene featuring the exodus from the city or the result of the continued resistance.

202325.description:
Sand and Snow is an expansion that will enhance your Mistfall and Heart of the Mists experience with a set of 110 brand new cards, you can add to any of one of the sets, or use when you mix them.

What is Sand and Snow?

Let’s start with a new type of Enemy: the Lieutenant. Easily recognizable by lacking a Resolve value, a Lieutenant is an alternate version of an existing Enemy which, when eliminated, allows you to take a Reward card right out of the display. Most Enemies appearing in Mistfall and Heart of the Mists will see their Lieutenant version in the Sand and Snow expansion.

New opportunities to receive Reward cards call for (you guessed it!) more Rewards. And you will get a nice big cache of brand new General Rewards. I’ve noticed over the last year that many of Mistfall fans wanted more cool loot, and besides bringing some to the Heart of the Mists box, you can now get an even greater number of new weapons, armour and arcane items to use against the Mists.

Sand and Snow will also feature a few new Allies, and a set of Special Event cards, drawn at specific times during the game, becoming essentially more permanent versions of Encounters. If you can beat them within a few turns of the game, you might be rewarded for your effort, and if you decide to ignore them, they will come back to bite you!
202325.name: Mistfall: Sand & Snow

202326.name: Das Distanzreiten
202326.description:
This game is about a horse race from Berlin to Viena and vice versa in 1892. One space represents 10 Kilometers. Movement is determined by a 18-sided die. The die results are as follows:
