WTG13 - The Board Game Leftovers Episode 3 : Terraforming Mars, V-Commandos, Adrenaline, & more!

202409.name: The Final Take
202409.description:
User Summary

Relive dark footage recorded from the perspective of multiple characters.

202410.name: Dead by Daylight
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Horror Game of the Year Winner
2016 Steam Awards Villain Most In Need Of A Hug Nominee
2017 SXSW Best Trending Game of the Year Nominee
202410.description:
When playing as a survivor, players assume the role of Dwight Fairfield, Meg Thomas, Jake Park, or Claudette Morel. The goal of the survivors is to escape the enclosed area, which can only be done in one of two ways: by activating a certain number of generators (usually the amount of generators is one more than the amount of survivors who are playing) so that they can activate any one of the large metal doors leading out of the area, or by escaping through a trapdoor that only appears when there is one survivor left, spawning in a random location.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_by_Daylight Dead by Daylight]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

202411.description:
The great mage Helion has seized power at the Forbidden Citadel. Now this tyrant is manipulating events all the way from the city of Covenant to the Dargothian Mountains.

Epic Card Game: Tyrants is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in four non-random booster packs (Draka's Rage, Markus' Command, Helion's Deceit, and Raxxa's Revenge), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards and a double-sided token.
202411.name: Epic Card Game: Tyrants – Helion's Deceit

202412.description:
Covenant is a city under siege. White Captain Markus enforces his harsh brand of justice on the people, rumors of a rebel leader have begun to inspire the masses to fight back.

Epic Card Game: Tyrants is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in four non-random booster packs (Draka's Rage, Markus' Command, Helion's Deceit, and Raxxa's Revenge), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards and a double-sided token.
202412.name: Epic Card Game: Tyrants – Markus' Command

202413.description:
The veil between the demon world and the human world is weakening. The Demon tyrant Raxxa is summoning his minions to spread destruction and solidify his power.

Epic Card Game: Tyrants is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in four non-random booster packs (Draka's Rage, Markus' Command, Helion's Deceit, and Raxxa's Revenge), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards and a double-sided token.
202413.name: Epic Card Game: Tyrants – Raxxa's Revenge

202414.name: 6 Tage-Rennen mit Rundengewinn
202414.description:
German cycling game from the late 1920s published by a company from Leipzig.

There are six riders in the game, divided into two teams. Three of the riders (black, red and yellow) have a special lap counter in their back wheel. These riders are moved with the three coloured dice on the outer lane (with roman numerals) and try to win a lap over their competitors. The game rules calls them "Tempofahrer", which might be translated as "endurance riders".

The three other riders are sprinters. They race each other on the inner lane at given intervals and compete just for some points which count only in case of a tie in the number of laps won.

There are the three coloured dice.

These three dice are thrown in turns and the riders in the outer lane advance as many fields as dice mark their colour or their teammate's (three-coloured dice would have been enough and probably better). However, if in a turn none of the dice shows your colour(s), you fall back to the red square with no lap won.

So you hope for a long run of throws with at least one of your colours to win a lap. And most often than not you get a bad throw when you have completed more than three quarters of a lap and you are very near your objective. That hurts!

Meanwhile, the sprinters wait their turn to play. At intervals (the rules are not particularly precise here) the coloured dice are put aside, the riders on the outer lane stay wherever they are, and a short sprint takes place between the three riders on the inner lane. No complicated rules here either, just throw and move, with a couple of penalty squares (2 -only reachable by a double one on the first throw- and 13). Teams whose sprinters land twice on these squares during the game (in different sprints, most probably) are penalized with one lap.

The rules state that some player or onlooker can call a sprint anytime during the game for a special price he is willing to offer (a present for the winner of that sprint). Just like the "primes" in 6-day races.

The player whose rider(s) perform best during the race by crossing the finish line first wins the game.

202415.name: Das Dansommer Radtour-Spiel
202415.description:
German cycling racing game, the board game is two sided, one side takes place in Denmark though since it was published by a company that also rents holiday cottages in Denmark, the other side of the board represents a fishing trip in Norway. The B-side is played with pedestrians, not with cyclists.

The game comes with 4 card board cyclists and 4 card board pedestrians.

The game is won by the player whose figure crosses the finish line first. On side A of the board the players use cyclists and race to the finish line with a role & move mechanics, side B is similar but here the players use pedestrians.

202416.name: Tour d'Autriche 2014
202416.description:
This is a free print-and-play game published by the cycling lobby from Austria.
It's about the Tour of Austira.
Strangely enough, the game has a French name.
It features roll & move mechanics, is playable up to 4 and has a map with the Tour of Austria track printed on.

202417.name: Le Tour de France: La Boîte à Quiz
202417.description:
Released by French company Marabout in their 'La Boîte à Quiz' series. This trivia style party game is about the Tour de France.

The author is French cycling journalist Jean-Paul Ollivier.

The yellow box contains 160 cards, divided in the five categories. The back of the cards is of a different colour for each category.

To give the game some "strategic" edge, there are 4 types of cards in each category.
22 (out of 32) cards in each category named after the category. Besides, there are 3 "booster" cards, 3 "accident" cards and 4 "contre la montre" (time trial) cards in each category. These cards have a different symbol in the back, making a total of 20 different card backs (5 colours, 4 symbols each).

The 22 "normal" cards give one point for a correct answer.The "booster" cards give three points, while the "accidents" deduct three points from the player in case of a wrong answer. The three categories of questions in the card are given different names for each type of card, which only adds a baroque touch to the game. In all cases the player only has to answer to one question, chosen by the opponent.

On the other hand, the time trial cards have four questions and the player must answer as many as he can in one minute, getting 1, 2, 3 or 5 points.
Winner is the player who scores the most points.

202418.name: Cyclisme-Question
202418.description:
Trivia style card game endorsed by the Fédération Française de Cyclisme.
It was published by a French company from Toulouse.

202419.name: Gépat
202419.description:
Obscure self-produced French cycling sports game.

The game was made by two guys called Gérard and Patrick (that's where the GÉPAT brand comes from), and it was an ambitious project since it comes with 4 different boards. A Time trial board, a flat coarse and 2 mountain stages.

The game has 11 plastic cyclists (including one in the yellow & mountain jersey) and is playable up to 8 (with each players one cyclist) or less (for example with 2 players each one has a team of 4 riders).

Movement in this racing game is decided by playing out cards (so no dice).

You can play a 1 day race or a stage tour with a general classification using all 4 boards.

202420.name: Windblade Hybrid Class
202420.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Windblade is a druid-sorcerer hybrid with deep connections to the sky. She harnesses the power of the currents to wield a weapon of pure energy. At higher levels she takes on the form of air, soaring through the clouds, fighting any foe who threatens the world below.

Contained Herein:

a complete 1-20 level hybrid class.
new feats
new spells that augment the Windblade's abilities

202421.description:
This game's box is an incredible German box-set that looks like a modernist piece of furniture.
The main game is a cycling board game but the box also contains a rowing and horse racing game.
The components / pieces that you play with (cyclists, horses and row boats) are made from metal.
Up to 6 players can take part and they can bet on the outcome of the race(s).
The board measures 40 x 20 cms (it is not that small after all) and it is just a 50-square-long track without any particular indication on it, except for the arrow that tells us that the riders will move clockwise.

Both the cyclists depicted on the board and the tin figurines included in the game have an unmistakable XIXth century look.

However, while the riders on the board look like racing cyclists, the tin figurines rather look like tourists.

The rules are very simple. This is a betting game in which any number of players can take part. Players do not manage a particular rider but just bet on the outcome of the race. Players must agree upon the numbers of laps, and cyclists move according to the throw of dice.

During their turn every player can move any cyclists since it is unknown who placed bets on which rider.

In a way this has similar mechanics like games as like Heimlich & Co. (hidden identity) and Reiner Knizia's classic horse racing game Winner's Circle (published by Alea) which also featured players making hidden bets during a race.
This is remarkable for an antique game from the early 20th century.

After the race is over and the riders have finished the races the players reveal their bets and he who placed the most accurate bets wins the game.
202421.name: Bycicleclub

202422.description:
Cycling board game published in Germany (in 1926), it's about indoor cycling and takes place on an oval track, those races are know as 6-tage rennen since they last 6 days.
It has a roll & move mechanic but overtaking is only possible in straights (which have black dots) with a higher number, the overtaken rider moves to the neighboring white dot, misses a turn, and resumes the race from the black dot.
You must reach exactly the last black point before each curve and overtaking in the curves is not allowed. The rider behind will stay behind losing any extra pips.
202422.name: Sechstage-Rennen

202424.name: The Zombie Shamble
202424.description:
The zombie apocalypse happened and the zombies won. Now what? There aren't any more people to eat and the rotting eternity is down-right boring. So, the zombies came up with the idea (if that's even possible) that foot-races would be neat. They certainly can be exciting – especially when pieces of the contestants fall off along the way!

Zombie Shamble is a fast-paced card game where players take on the roles of zombies trying to do their best to get across the finish line. It's not all that far away, but remember that you're an animated rotting corpse and all kind of craziness can happen in just a few steps.

First to 25 steps wins. Deal out 6 cards each, then draw a card, play a card. The cards are Steps (move towards finish line), Calamities (eg a leg falls off; fixed by Duct Tape card), Fortune (usually cancels a Calamity), a Trump card (eg Steely Eyed, so cannot be distracted). Oh, and that's exactly 25 steps, not more. Else the Zombie Judges won't be happy. But might be hungry.

202425.name: THE Houki Guitars
boardgamepublisher: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)
202425.description:
User summary
THEほうきギターズ (THE Houki Guitars) in English means "THE Broom & Guitars" (with the emphasis on THE intentional).

In the game of THE Broom & Guitars, you lead a music band of high-school students, and compete against rival bands with your live performance.

This game is based on the traditional Japanese game Shichi Narabe with some twists.

There are four suits that correspond to parts of the band: Vocal, Guitar, Bass, Drums, and each suit has seven levels ranging from 1 to 7,

You buy an instrument card you want to upgrade, and at a later turn you place that card out at appropriate position on the board like Shichi Narabe (the card being placed must be adjacent to an existing card), but unlike Shichi Narabe, vertical connections and diagonal connections are allowed as well as horizontal connections. You advance your skill of that instrument (or vocal) in this way.

Once all cards of one suit are bought, it's time for live performance. All players count victory points according to skill levels they reached for each suit.

That's one round. After the second round, the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
メンバーを集めてバンドを結成します。
バイトをして楽器を入手したり、楽器を練習をやりつつ
ライブで客をより熱狂させたほうが勝者です。
カードを一定のルールを元に出し、それに応じてコマを進めるゲームです。最も効率よくコマを進めることを目指します。

202426.name: Sidereal Confluence: Trading and Negotiation in the Elysian Quadrant
202426.description:
Sidereal Confluence: Trading and Negotiation in the Elysian Quadrant is a singularly unique trading and negotiation game for 4-9 players. Over the course of the game, each race must trade and negotiate with the rest to acquire the resource cubes necessary to fund their economy and allow it to produce goods for the next turn. Scheming, dealing, and mutually beneficial agreements are key to success. While technically a competitive game, Sidereal Confluence has a uniquely cooperative feel during the trading phase as no race has the ability to thrive on its own. Trade well, and you'll develop technologies and colonize planets to form a civilization that is the envy of the galaxy.

Each player chooses one of the nine unique and asymmetrical alien races that have come together to form a trade federation in their quadrant. Each race has its own deck of cards representing all the existing and future technologies it might research. Some races also have other cards related to unique features of their culture. These cards represent portions of the culture's economy and require spending some number of cubes to use, resulting in an output of more cubes, ships, and possibly victory points. Since each culture's outputs rarely match their inputs, players need to trade goods with one another to run their converters to create the resources they truly need to run their society most efficiently and have an effective economy. Almost everything is negotiable, including colonies, ships, VP and all kids of resources.

Each game round contains an open trading phase in which all players can negotiate and execute deals for cubes, ships, colonies, even the temporary use of technologies! Players with enough resources can also research technologies, upgrade colonies, and spend resources on their race's special cards during this phase. Once complete, all players simultaneously run their economies, spending resources to gain more resources. The Convocation follows, starting with players sharing newly researched technologies with all other races and following with bidding to acquire new colonies and research teams. Researching a new technology grants many victory points for the prestige of helping galactic society advance. When one race builds a new technology, it is shared with everyone else. Technologies can be upgraded when combined with other technologies.

The ultimate goal is victory points, which are acquired by researching technologies, using your economy to convert resources to goods, and converting your leftover goods into points at the end of the game.

The game is almost all simultaneous play.

202428.name: Vampire Waltz
202428.description:
From the introduction:

The players will play, evenly divided, the vampires, the hunters
and the prey...This is a freeform game: you will have to perform a dance. For real. A room with enough space to dance will therefore be needed. A comfy couch or some cushions too. And some red wine would be a nice touch.

When it’s your turn to dance, you have to choose another
player.

202429.name: Last Transmission (2016)
202429.description:
User summary:

This game involves inter-species communication between human (the player characters) and an alien species. To simulate the difficulty of understanding the aliens, questions and answers each go through a process of repeated translation. The game uses an ingenious method of utilizing computerized translation services to move phrases through multiple translations, yielding an output that is similar, but garbled, from the input.

202430.name: Map Maker 13
202430.description:
From the introduction:

You've just dropped out of hyperspace, in a new system, the job starts again, whilst the Map Maker 13 recharges its solar cells you get to explore this new system and create a Map Buoy Satellite to leave in your wake transmitting your findings for all who come this way.
...
NOTE: A ship that is on fire cannot jump into hyperspace

User summary:

One of the more darkly humorous aspects of the game concerns the officers and crew of the ship. The player characters are the officers. The crew otherwise is comprised of fifty enlisted men. In the game, they are more or less expendable resources (think "red shirts"), though flagrant use may exhaust the supply prior to the end of the mission - prudent expenditure is warranted.

202431.name: Mercury Falling
202431.description:
User summary:

Players in the game collectively control an "enclave" of surviving humans. Some members of the "enclave" may be singled out as "focus" characters with special abilities, etc. These closely align with traditional player characters but need to be played by the same player always. Thus, roleplaying in the game is a collaborative experience. Action resolution uses a d6 - d6 approach, necessitating two dice of different colors.

202432.name: Mirror Ball
202432.description:
From the introduction:

In Mirror Ball, you’ll describe scenes in which you attempt to complete a task or remove obstacles. In these scenes, you’ll bring words, tech, and obstacles into your descriptions of events to create dice pools. You’ll create a pool of dice for your Dancer [character] and your Alarm [rotating game master] will create a pool of dice to oppose your attempt.

202433.name: Security Theater
202433.description:
From the introduction:

You had six weeks to plan, prepare, and execute the biggest caper of your career. You were up against one of the most technologically advanced security systems ever built. It was called Security Theater, named after the company who built it, and the play on words was intentional. Security Theater wanted to lull potential thieves into believing the company was just for show, and that reputation seemed to bear itself out. There were few, if any, reports of successful arrests. Indeed, the rumors among the larceny community indicated that collections protected by Security Theater were easy marks. But that was just as the company intended—in every previous attempt, the thieves involved actually died or were severely maimed in the process, but Security Theater somehow managed to keep the violence out of the press.

202434.name: Selfie Culture in the Court of the Sun-Sovereign
rpg: Selfie Culture in the Court of the Sun-Sovereign
202434.description:
From the introduction:

The game is played over a number of rounds, each representing a formal ball, with each ball divided into four phases: Invitation, Preparation, Encounter, and Resolution. After there have been a number of balls equal to one more than the number of players, the game ends and the player with the highest social status is declared the winner.

User summary:

The game is designed to be played over social media where all responses are shared by all participants. The game also is designed to handle large numbers of players - from five to fifteen being optimal. Player characters take turns hosting balls in the virtual social media world.

202435.name: Monocacy/Ft. Stevens
202435.description: The third game in the Line of Battle Series covering Jubal Early's campaign in the summer of 1864 to either take Washington DC or to threaten it sufficiently that forces would be stripped from Grant's efforts to advance against Richmond. The two battles (one on two maps the other on one) can be fought as a campaign where the player's success (or lack of it) at Monocacy affects his chances at the gates of Washington.

202436.name: Sunlight (1st Edition)
202436.description:
From the introduction:

This is a sci-fi game intended to be played via webcam for an immersive experience. One takes the role of Command, while the rest are Citizens who were being transported when the glitch occurred. All must work together, share information and complete tasks to succeed.

User summary:

Play involves several randomization steps used during setup, and an ingenious method of plotting "star charts" (graphs) that can be solved through collaboration. While the scenario is fairly straightforward, the various random elements and the intriguing play method allow for excellent replay value.

202437.name: Sunshine Over My Shoulder
202437.description:
From the introduction:

The president has recently signed the Professionally Accountable Positivity Act, a law that authorizes a national database that can track negative people who undermine economic growth and social progress with their negative attitudes. The Profound Positivity movement has already had great uptake in the software industry, and expanding it to cover everyone can only make things better. The company you work for, Sunshine Solutions, has just landed a government contract to expand your proprietary database service to implement nationwide coverage. Management knows that completing this project on schedule will prove challenging, especially given how short-staffed your division is, so they've brought in a positivity consultant from Blythe Associates so you can get the maximum benefit from the power of positive thinking.

Most of the players will play software developers employed by Sunshine Solutions, one of them will also be the project manager. Another won't play a specific character but will be the GM who is responsible for playing the rest of the world, preparing some things before play begins, and generally managing and coordinating the flow of the game.

202439.name: Technobabble
202439.description:
From the introduction:

As space engineers, you have the knowledge and skills you need to maintain your hyper-complex star ship. The rest of the crew are completely reliant on you and your brain. And you are completely reliant on the technology around you. Simple tasks were automated centuries ago, and only enthusiasts and hobbyists retain this archaic knowledge.

Not only that, but the ship is so complex that no one person can comprehend the intricacies of maintenance, repair, and even communicating the concepts at work. The other engineers you work with find everything you say as confusing as the things they say to you. Each niche area of knowledge is unique and vital, and you will need to work together to fill in the missing gaps in your data. Like a tag team of trained dentists, all working on the same tooth.

202440.name: The Heavenly Circle of Cartographers
202440.description:
From the introduction:

The Divine Queen has created a Heavenly Circle of cartographers. The Queen in her wisdom has decided to open the doors [of the kingdom] to the wider world. She has plucked the most sharp-eyed, the most nimble-fingered, and the most adaptable members of the community and taught them the art of map-making. This Heavenly Circle will travel down from the Sunlit Mountain and discover what lies in the shadows.

As Cartographers of the Heavenly Circle, you will go forth and explore new lands. You will seek out other peoples and other civilizations. You will spread the word of the Sun Queen. And you will build a map of what you find for the glory of the Queen.

202441.name: Spellcaster: Potions
202441.description: The Potions Expansion contains 20 new spell cards (five in each color) and 12 potion bottles.

202442.name: The Prom Directive
202442.description:
From the introduction:

You are top-of-the-line security robots made by EcoPrague Incorporated with a very innovative and relatively new system where you store solar energy to power you up for upwards of six hours into the night. However, you and your other robot buddies were rented out by a very rich company a week before that was possible. Worst of all, you were assigned to guard what many consider a teenage rite of passage: prom.

Making things worse is that you and your friends have a very limited supply of solar energy. By working together, you and your friends must find a way to prevent the prom from being ruined. Not only that, but you also cannot be seen by the teenagers or anyone lacking the knowledge of your existence, lest they freak out at your appearance and figure that something’s up.

1. A robot must not harm a human, even through inaction.
2. A robot must follow the orders of their master, unless if it contrasts rule 1.
3. A robot must protect themselves, unless it contrasts rules 1 or 2.
...
However, there are two Zeroth Laws that override the three laws. The first being the Prom Directive...

User summary:

The characters are robots. Their owners are illogical.

202443.description:
Barker's Row is a 2-4 player game in which you are a carnival barker trying to fill your 3D chipboard seats with "rube" meeples by playing the most fantastic Attractions.

You draft these Barker cards from a community pool and play them into the Midway. Then you use those cards to play one of ~50 Attractions that will amaze and delight the rube meeples in your seats while giving you a special power to use later in the game. Stay tuned for some drafts of these Attractions, such as Lobster Boy, Goose-Necked Girl, and the Fiji Mermaid. Each time you play an Attraction, you climb higher on the Strongman Tower, making the next one harder to play, serving as an elegant and thematic catch-up mechanic. The player to first fill all their seats wins!
202443.name: Barker's Row

202444.name: West Riding
202444.description:
From the introduction:

West Riding is a collaborative, card-prompted storytelling game based on real historical accounts and events. Each player takes on the role of a Luddite who was captured when about 150 Luddites attacked Rawfolds Mill on the 11th April, 1812.

The goal is not to win—the game always ends as it did in real life, with the Luddites hanging from a scaffold. Instead, the aim of the game is simply to explore the stories of the condemned men, to understand why and how their lives came to this end.

202445.name: Impact Winter
202445.description:
From the introduction:

Impact Winter allows for touch as a gameplay mechanic. Before play begins, every player should discuss their comfort with physical touch.
...
Impact Winter will utilize a form of sensory deprivation known as the Ganzfeld Effect. This effect requires a light source (a regular ceiling lamp should be adequate). A paper mask worn over the eyes will diffuse the light to create a uniform visual field and headphones playing white noise will create uniform audio input.

User summary:

The game is distributed as a ZIP archive that creates a directory structure when expanded. The included files are:

- Rulebook (18-page PDF)
- Event Cards (1-page PDF; print-and-play component)
- Ganzfeld Mask Letter (1-page PDF; print-and-play component)
- Ganzfeld Mask A4 (1-page PDF; print-and-play component)
- Logbook (17-page PDF; print-and-play component)
- Audio File Transcript (6-page PDF)
- Seven audio files
- Writer's Comments (1-page PDF)

202446.name: Dead Gods: 5th Edition Conversion
202446.description:
From the introduction:

This is an easy conversion for all mechanics in the campaign Dead Gods from Planescape AD&D Second Edition to D&D Fifth Edition. You must own the original campaign book to use this conversion.

The original adventure was written by Monte Cook. It's designed for 4-6 characters between 6th and 9th levels, but the adventure works well for PCs of any level with very minimal modifications.

User summary:

Appendix II of this document presents all text excluded from the "damaged" adventure product that circulated in some retail areas.

202447.name: The Wizard's Tower (2004)
202447.description:
From the introduction:

For a while now a local Wizard has been causing trouble, poking around for the four parts of The Staff of the Winds, it seems he’s finally found all four. The Dark Lord is most pleased, now he needn’t track them all down himself, all he has to do is send a few Orks along to get them...

202448.name: Camp PowerFULL
202448.description:
From the introduction:

You have been sitting in the doctor's office for a while. You don't want to be here. You thought you were being careful. You wonder if they bring all of those like you straight past the waiting room and right into the exam room...

Finally, the door opens and the doctor walks in. Let's get this over with, you think. No use keeping anything back anymore. now, everyone knows...

User summary:

The game consists of these documents:

- Camp PowerFULL (8-page PDF rules)
- Mat Cards (8-page PDF print-and-play)
- Player Pack (2-page PDF print-and-play)
- Player Pack 2 (3-page color PDF print-and-play)

Note that each player will require a printed copy of the Mat Cards and both player packs.

202449.name: Simufant (Nummer 4 - Nov 1984)
202449.description:
User summary

The November issue appeared a month early so it could be released in time for the Spielertage Essen (12.-14. Oct. 1984).

It includes articles on movement rules in cosims, alignment in AD&D, and new worlds for Traveller, plus a wealth of reviews.

202451.name: Simufant (Nummer 5 - Feb 1985)
202451.description:
User summary

After the previous issue #4, Simufant had to switch printers. This change also prompted a new price, a new format (A4 instead of A5), and an overall push for more professionalism.

Issue #5 includes an (A)D&D scenario, new worlds for Traveller, a short story, and a range of articles and reviews.

202452.name: Simufant (Nummer 6 - April 1985)
202452.description:
User summary

Issue #6 contains a Daredevil scenario, new worlds for Traveller, supplementary rules and clarifications for Kolonial (a game that was published in Simufant Extraausgabe 1), as well as various articles, news, and reviews.

202453.description:
The expansion of the tribe goes on in Targi: Die Erweiterung, an expansion for Targi. With water as a new element, the tribe has more flexibility in how it will extend itself. More specifically, in the game water functions like a joker, e.g., you can swap two water tokens for any one goods token. Many of the new tribe cards, which replace the set in the base game, allow players to choose to spend gold or water tokens, which can make it a little easier to build.

The Targia — a Tuareg woman — is a special pawn like the robber, but has a more positive effect for players. She starts in the opposite direction of the robber and moves each turn one edge card. When you place one of your Targi on the same card, you receive a favor: Either take a goods token of your choice or spend one good to reveal the top card from the draw pile and receive what it shows. Now a less attractive edge card might be more interesting because the Targia offers an additional reward.

Finally, shifting sand cards give the players rather strong immediate advantages when they place a Targi on them — but since these shifting sands are placed next to the central playing area, you lose an intersection on the central cards.
202453.name: Targi: Die Erweiterung
boardgamepodcastepisode: 30 Minutes Around the Table

rpgitemversion: German revised and expanded print (2. Auflage)
202454.name: Flight from the Dark (Revised)
202454.description:
User summary
This is a revised and expanded version of the first Lone Wolf gamebook, Book 01: Flight from the Dark. It contains 550 sections.

From the back of the book (German)
Dein Name ist Einsamer Wolf. Bei einem hinterhältigen Angriff der Schwarzen Lords wird das Kloster, in dem du zum Kai ausgebildet wirst, vom Feind zerstört. Du bist der einzige Überlebende!

Du schwörst Rache. Doch zunächst musst du Holmgard erreichen und König Ulnar vor den Horden des Bösen warnen. Der Weg, der nun vor dir liegt, birgt tödliche Gefahren, und der Feind ist dir dicht auf den Fersen.

Auf jeder Seite dieses Buches musst du dich neuen Herausforderungen stellen, darum wähle deine Waffen und Fähigkeiten mit Bedacht. Nur mit ihrer Hilfe wirst du das fantastischste und spannendste Abenteuer deines Lebens bestehen können.

Die Abenteuer von Einsamer Wolf sind eine einzigartige interaktive Fantasy-Serie. Wenn du dieses Abenteuer überstanden hast, kannst du deinen Kampf gegen das Böse in weiteren Bänden der Reihe Einsamer Wolf fortsetzen. Werde Teil dieser einzigartigen Rollenspiel-Saga!

Publisher blurb (German)

Du bist "Einsamer Wolf". Während eines hinterhältigen Angriffs der dämonischen Schwarzen Lords wurde die Abtei, in der du die edlen Fähigkeiten der Kai-Mönche erlernt hast, völlig zerstört. Du bist der einzige Überlebende dieses grausamen Massakers!

Nun hast du Rache geschworen und befindest dich inmitten einer epischen Schlacht zwischen Gut und Böse. Als letzter der Kai, bist Du die einzige Hoffnung für dein Königreich und die freien Reiche der Menschen, die sich im Krieg mit den Schwarzen Lords und ihren finsteren Kreaturen befinden. Mit jedem Buch dieser fantastischen Fantasy Saga musst du dich neuen tödlichen Herausforderungen stellen, die all dein Geschick, deine Kraft und Weisheit fordern. Auf diesem gefährlichen Weg durch unzählige Abenteuer, können dich nur deine richtigen Entscheidungen zum Erfolg und damit zum Sieg der Menschheit über die Mächte des Bösen führen.

Die Abenteuer von "Einsamer Wolf" sind eine einzigartige interaktive Fantasy Serie. Jede Episode dieser Serie kann einzeln und für sich gespielt werden oder aber zusammen mit den anderen Büchern dieser Serie zu einem fantastischen Rollenspiel Epos kombiniert werden.

Das Abenteuer beginnt jetzt, mit dem ersten Teil dieser fantastischen Fantasy Saga: FLUCHT AUS DEM DUNKEL.

rpgitemversion: Lone Wolf: część 2 - Ogień na Wodzie
202455.name: Fire on the Water (Revised)
202455.description:
Publisher blurb
You are Lone Wolf last of the Kai Lords. Bitter War rages through your homeland as the evil Darklords of the west lay siege to the capital. FIRE ON THE WATER The King has sent you on a desperate journey to retrieve the only power in Magnamund that can save your people: the Sommerswerd, the sword of the sun. Ahead of lie terrible dangers - ferocious seastorms, the tunnel of Tarnalin and the ghostly death-hulks of Vonotar the Traitor. Use your skills wisely - for only you can save your land from the devastation of the Darklords. The LONE WOLF adventures are a unique interactive fantasy series each episode can be played separately or you can combine them all to create a fantastic role-playing epic.

From the back of the book (German)
Du bist Einsamer Wolf - der letzte Kai Lord! Setze dein Abenteuer mit dem zweiten Band dieser Rollenspielserie Feuer über den Wassern fort und werde Teil dieser einzigartigen Fantasy-Saga.

Der König entsendet dich auf eine gefahrvolle Reise. Deine Aufgabe ist es, den einen besonderen Gegenstand wiederzuerlangen, welcher dein Volk retten kann - das Sommerswerd - das sagenumwobene Schwert der Sonne! Vor dir liegen große Gefahren - wilde Meeresstürme, der gefahrvolle Tunnel von Tarnalin und die geisterhaften Totenschiffe des Magiers Vonotar.

Nutze deine Fähigkeiten weise, denn nur du kannst dein Land vor der Zerstörung durch die Schwarzen Lords bewahren!

Im Zusatzabenteuer Die Krone von König Alin IV. schlüpfst du in die Rolle von Oberstatthalter Rhygar, dem sommerlendischen Botschafter in Durenor. Als die Krone des durenesischen Königs gestohlen wird, begibst du dich sofort auf die Suche nach dem Dieb. Kannst du die Spur aufnehmen und den Übeltäter stellen oder fällst du während deines Auftrags den zahlreichen Gefahren zum Opfer?

Jedes Buch der Einsamer Wolf Saga kannst du einzeln für sich oder kombiniert mit den anderen Abenteuern dieser Reihe als einzigartige Rollenspielsaga spielen und erleben.

202456.name: Slügs!
202456.description:
[From back cover]

Slügs! is a themed bestiary designed to infuse weirdness and chaos into role-playing games.

Even yours.

202457.description: Roosan gets another interesting ability in Catacombs: Teleport. It's the simple, standard teleport effect as an Ability, but it's one more run-around-like-a-chicken-with-its-head-cut-off thing that Roosan can do in each fight. This promotional card will be included in the Catacombs & Castles Kickstarter package, but also was offered at Origins 2016, so fans [of Roosan] could start using it immediately.
202457.name: Catacombs: Teleport

202458.name: We B4 Goblins!
202458.description:
[User description:]

Pathfinder adds a fourth installment in the popular Licktoad Goblins series for Free RPG Day 2016.

A prequel to the previous three scenarios, this entry features the goblins crashing a wedding, with plenty of opportunity for mayhem.

202459.description:
Description from the publisher:

Imperial Settlers: Aztecs bring new rules, a new resource, and a sixth faction to the world of Imperial Settlers!

Prayer actions and blessing tokens bring religion to the world, while the Aztecs build temples and organize festivals and ceremonies to gain favors and be blessed! With this expansion, all other factions will also be able to add religion and their own pantheon of gods to their Empires.

This expansion includes a new faction board, the Aztecs faction deck, blessing tokens, and expansion cards for the original factions that complement the Aztecs abilities.
202459.name: Imperial Settlers: Aztecs
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 72 - Clank with Sunken Treasures
RDTN Episode 115: VAST, Imperial Settlers-Aztecs, Balloon Pop, and Interview with Justin Jacobson
RDTN Episode 98: Cry Havoc, The Walking Dead – No Sanctuary, Sadler Brothers and Ignacy

202460.name: Swords Against the Dead / The Van Helsing Letter
202460.description:
[User summary]

A two-in-one offering from Pelgrane Press for Free RPG Day 2016, this product includes scenarios for both 13th Age and Night's Black Agents.

Both scenarios were penned by Gareth Ryder-Hanrahan. Or keyboarded, as the case may be.

202461.name: Escape from Alfadabin
202461.description:
[User Summary]

An adventure seed and quickstart for Faith: The Sci-fi RPG released on Free RPG Day 2016.

Escape from Alfadabin teaches the game in a comic book format with a cast of colorful aliens. There's a human, too, for good measure.

202462.name: The Demon Stones (Swords & Wizardry)
202462.description:
From publisher blurb:

When huge stones fall out of the night sky,
A deadly curse settles over Gravencross.
Help the village exorcise the Demon Stones.

“The sun had set an hour ago, and the rain lashed down and the wind howled on the dark moor. A storm this late in the season was unusual, but this one seemed different. The clouds were more menacing, tinged with anger, the rain colder and more biting than usual.

Skerrill had to find the lost calf and get him back to the farm before his father came back from the city on business. He’d been looking for two hours now, and he was right in the middle of the moor when the storm hit. He knew he should have turned back as soon as darkness fell, but then he was never the brightest boy in the valley. If only he had remembered to lock the farm gate.

The calf was now likely dead anyway having stumbled among the boulders and rocks, panicking in the dark, and then fallen in a floodwater stream and drowned. Either way, he was in more trouble than he could imagine.

Suddenly, a bright flash of white light and a roaring peal of thunder were preceded by an explosion as a huge object fell from the sky and impacted the ground of the moor no more than a stone’s throw from him. Dirt, mud, water, and debris erupted from the impact site, flying high into the air and then covering the moor for hundreds of feet all around.

Skerrill was knocked to the ground instantly and covered in the fallout from the blast. His ears rang and his head spun, but he staggered to his feet in a daze.

He stumbled to where the blast had happened only moments before, and in a depression in the ground lay a huge stone glowing orange as if hot. Skerrill passed out.

Two more thunderous explosions crashed in the distance.”

An adventure compatible with Swords 7 Wizardry and other OSR games - for 3-5 characters of level ranges 4 to 5.
The adventure takes place in an area called the Hoarwych Valley, which can fit into any campaign.
The small village of Gravencross is richly detailed and works as a standalone base for adventuring in any campaign.
Could be converted to other systems with relative ease.
New monsters: Ostopheles, lesser basalt elementals, and fyrs,
New god: Basaltor,

202463.name: Swiftsark
202463.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Swiftsark is a clipper, designed to move small, valuable cargoes at enormous speeds. It is specifically designed to bring the first harvest of luxury crops to market, in competition with numerous other merchants looking to earn that premium for being first into port.

This makes ths spaceship an interesting design compromise. It is long and thin to take advantage of the FTL bubble it rips in space. It is faster than most navy ships, ideal for blockade running, but doesn't have the guns or armor to defend itself, if caught.

It's a spaceship for speed demons, captains who are born to run.

202464.name: Epic Level NPC Hybrid Class Trainer
202464.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.”
Winston S. Churchill

In the villages, on the roads, or in the wild, the Trainer and her pet beasts scout the way, take down threats and battle other Trainers for honor, glory and fun.

Inside you’ll find:

A 20-level hybrid class
2 sample pet beasts
4 magic items

202465.name: Valiant Universe Quick Start Rules: Experience the Fog of War!
202465.description:
[From back cover]

No matter the powers, no matter the choices, the price in body and mind may be more than you're willing to pay. And your choices will lead to heroics ... or to villainy. How will you be remembered?

202467.name: Crossing the Alps
202467.description:
This is a simple roll and move game where each player must try to move five men "across the alps" on his playing card. Each card has a row of circles marked "5", two rows of mountain scenery, and a row of goats. Unusually, the rules are printed on the front cover of the box.

Players take turns rolling a single die. Rolls of 2, 4 and 6 count for nothing. A roll of 5 allows a man to be put on the first row. A roll of 3 allows a move directly from the first (5) row to the goat row. And a roll of 1 allows a man to move forward a single row - but once in the alps, a 3 roll is useless to him. First player to get all five men to the goat row wins.

202468.name: Wacky Pirates
202468.description:
In Wacky Pirates you are racing your Pirate Ship to the cursed Skull Island in search of a big treasure. But beware... there are other Wacky Pirates on the horizon! You will need to find Treasure Maps to sail faster, use Rum to re-roll your dice, and fire your Cannons to attack other players. Meanwhile the Skull Island will try to take your Silver Coins by cursing your dice. Do you have what it takes to become the richest Wacky Pirate? Grab your Pirate Dice and go on an adventure in this fast-paced racing game!

Wacky Pirates is a quick press-your-luck style racing game driven by 5 large custom wooden Pirate Dice. Each player is a Wacky Pirate with a unique ability. The goal of this game is to gain Silver Coins by cleverly performing actions on your Pirate Dice. The first player with 6 Gold Coins is the winner of the game!

202469.name: Hong Kong Task Force 88
202469.description:
User summary:

An introductory Feng Shui 2 scenario featuring an investigation into a shady pharmaceutical corporation in Hong Kong, along with plenty of fight scenes.

202470.name: Ultimae Litterae
202470.description:
You might consider this game as Big Bang Theory meeting Happy Families in the Roaring 20s - in Latin.

This is very much a Latin educational game, and consists of a deck of 65 cards divided into 13 "books" of five cards. As the rules put it: "Each book embraces declensions and conjugation forms ending in certain letters, as, es, i, um, etc."

A book's word ending appears in capitals in the middle of each card, followed by a specific example, such as "-US Gen. Sing. 4th Dec." (genitive singular fourth declension). Partial information to the other cards in the book appear on the four corners of a card along with one or more question marks.

Play is similar to Happy Families, with players taking turns asking other players for the cards needed to complete a book. But in this game, a player must ask for a card by its full form, by filling in the question marks on a card he already holds. And to ask for the King card in each book, the player must recite correctly all of the other forms in the book! The player to collect the most books wins.

202471.name: Video Blogger Story
202471.description:
User Summary

You play the role of a video-blogger, starting from the bottom and finishing at the top.

202472.name: Dumme Dame
202472.description:
Dumme Dame is an abstract 2 player game printed on a postcard. Only a pencil is needed (and an eraser for multiple plays).

The playing field consists of 4 x 4 spaces. One player starts and writes a number between 1 and 3 into one of the fields and adds an orthogonal or diagonal arrow to the field. The next player follows the arrow and starts his/her player on the target space (the written number is the distance in spaces from the origininal space). Some limitations apply:

No move may lead over or onto an already used field.
No move may lead towards an arrow (no back and forth movement).




The player who cannot make a legal move loses.

202473.description: Old School Tactical:Stalingrad is an expansion to the Old School Tactical system featuring a large map, counters and a scenario book covering small unit actions during the battle for Stalingrad. The map is an exact recreation of the Nail Factory area of the city. The scenario book contains 6 scenarios pitting Soviet and German troops in close quarters battle.
202473.name: Old School Tactical: Stalingrad

202474.name: Seven At One Blow
202474.description:
From The Front Cover:

A Survival Horror Comedy Hack Compatible With Everything OSR. A Primer for Epic Zero Roleplaying Featuring a Deep Frozen Yeti Hunt Introductory Adventure Sandbox,

202475.description:
This upgrade set is intended for people who have the 1st or 2nd edition of Food Chain Magnate and want to have the new materials.

For the 3rd and later printings of Food Chain Magnate, a number of improvements were made based on feedback by players and reviewers:

•Milestone information is now on the back of the English player menus
•Clarifications to the rules (but no rule changes)
•Added dots to the 9 and 6 marketeer busy tiles.

In addition, the following misprints were corrected:

•The 6 on the Executive Vice President in the player menu has become a 10
•Three of the marketing tools that were missing infinity symbols on the back no have them.
202475.name: Food Chain Magnate: Improved Rules and Aids

202476.name: Cation
202476.description:
Introduction

Cation is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.


Definitions

A crosscut is a 2x2 pattern of stones consisting of two diagonally adjacent black stones and two diagonally adjacent white stones.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you will face one of these situations:

a) There are no crosscuts on the board. In this case, you must place a stone of your color on an empty point such that it forms no crosscuts containing a stone that was placed or moved by the opponent on their latest turn. If there is no such placement available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. A passed turn is still a turn.

b) There are one or more crosscuts on the board. In this case, you must take a friendly stone from one of those crosscuts and place it on a different empty point where it doesn't create any other crosscuts. If no such point exists, the stone is simply removed from the board.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color. Draws are not possible.


Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on their first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.

202477.name: Bananagrams Party
202477.description:
Bananagrams is a Scrabble-like game without the board that's much like Pick Two!, but without the letter values.

In the basic game, using a selection of 144 plastic letter tiles, each player works independently to create their own "crossword". When a player has incorporated all of their letters in their crossword, all players take a new tile from the pool. When all the tiles are gone, the first player to use up all the tiles in their hand wins.

Bananagrams Party adds fourteen "party power" tiles to the letter mix, with each of these tiles — The Re-Gifter, The Thief, Switcheroo, Pouch Head, etc. — giving its holder a unique power in the game.

202478.name: My First Bananagrams
boardgamepodcastepisode: Strange Assembly 190 - GenCon 2016 Preview

Bananagrams is a Scrabble-like game without the board that's much like Pick Two!, but without the letter values.

In the regular game, using a selection of 144 plastic letter tiles, each player works independently to create their own "crossword". When all the tiles are gone, the first player to use up all the tiles in their hand wins.

By contrast, My First Bananagrams has 80 lower-case letters and 13 dual-letter combo tiles that players use in multiple activities and minigames.

202479.name: Rhode
202479.description:
Introduction

Rhode is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.


Definitions

A weak pair is a set of two like-colored, diagonally adjacent stones such that there is no like-colored stone orthogonally adjacent to both.

A crosscut is a 2x2 set of stones consisting of two diagonally adjacent black stones and two diagonally adjacent white stones. A stone can be part of several crosscuts at the same time.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate.

At the start your turn, if there are any friendly weak pairs on the board, you must place a stone of your color on an empty point that is orthogonally adjacent to the two stones in one of those pairs. If there are no such pairs, you must place a stone of your color on any empty point.

After a placement, all friendly stones, except the one just placed, that are part of any crosscuts are removed from the board, after which the turn ends. There will be no crosscuts remaining on the board at this point.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color. Draws are not possible.


Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on their first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.

202481.name: The Madhouse Meet / The Museum at the End of Time
rpgpodcastepisode: Mutant Crawl Classics: The Museum at the End of Time
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
202481.description:
From the back of the book:

You're no hero. You're no adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them...

This product contains two complete adventures that preview Fritz Leiber's Lankhmar and Mutant Crawl Classics.

User summary:

Published with five variant covers (product codes Cover A, Cover B, Cover C, Cover D, Cover E); contents otherwise identical.

202482.name: Acropolis of Voor Darayn (5E)
202482.description:
From the back of the book:

Centuries ago, the dark sorcerer Tur Nyaan built an extravagant palace atop a hill called Voor Darayn. For decades, he demanded tribute from nearby cities and trade routes, and summoned mighty demons or conjured terrible curses to punish those who refused him. Tur Nyaan's reign of terror ended a century ago, when death finally claimed him... or so it is believed. So why is it that summoned demons have once again appeared in the nearby cities, demanding tribute in his name?

User summary:

An adventure for characters of levels 5th - 9th

202483.name: Sixteen Tons
202483.description:
From the back of the book:

The life of a miner isn't easy. Between the long hours, the hard work, and the constant threat of cave-in or flooding, it's the sort of job that can drive a person to drink.

In the town of temperance, however, things are about the get a whole lot worse. Hunched creatures move through the cramped tunnels, miners are disappearing, and the strange woman that's been hanging around at the edge of town... well, she's got her own plans for Temperance.

Grab a pick axe and some dynamite, because things are about to get crazy.

202484.name: Under the Blood Red Moon
202484.description:
From the back of the book:

Matyas in an old man. A long life of adventure has left him satisfied and ready to pass to the Arc of Time and meet his patron, Toth, the Shadow of the All Father. Satisfied, but for one last task. It is in his mind to make a final sacrifice to Toth by placing a magical parchment, reputed to hold the cure for lycanthropy, beneath an Alter Stone of the Temple of Toth. But this is easier said than done, for the Temple is over-run with evil and he is too old to undertake the task. So he turns to his kin, asking one to gather their friends and make this sacrifice for him!

User summary:

For 2 - 4 characters, with a challenge level of 2nd - 5th

202485.name: The Dark Eye Quick-Start Rules (Free RPG Day 2016 Version)
202485.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the thrilling world of The Dark Eye! Heroic adventure awaits you in the fantasy setting of Aventuria. This guide explains the basic concepts of the game, and the introductory scenario and pre-generated characters allow you and your friends to start playing right away!

User summary:

This item is very similar to the more-common Quick-Start rules for the game, though they are not identical. This item has additional content, is printed on better paper with a card-stock cover, and has some different interior art. It is easily recognized by the Free RPG Day logo on the cover.

202486.name: Gaming Paper Adventure Maps: Mega Dungeon 4 - Rooftops and Alleyways (Sample Pack)
202486.description:
From the back of the book:

Gaming Paper Adventure Maps can be used to build thousands of unique dungeons in practically any shape or configuration.

User summary:

This Sample Pack includes a subset of sheets taken from the full product.

202488.description:
A free collection of three short experimental games (Hurt Me Plenty, Succulent, and Stick Shift) about male sexuality, punishing, eating, and driving.

Source: The Game Website.

Jackpot Party Casino simulates various casino activities.

202490.name: Chickapig
202490.description:
Break your flock of Chickapigs free while dodging opponents, hay bales, and an unruly pooping cow in this strategic board game.

The first player to get their 6 Chickapigs off the board wins. You must coordinate your Chickapigs, Hay Bales, and the Cow to help your Chickapigs escape through their goal. At the same time, play defense against your opponents with your pieces, or use the Cow to drop a poop in their way. Whenever someone goes over a poop, they must take a poop card which are always bad. There are also Daisy cards which are always good.

Chickapig is an abstract game with enough chance to keep everyone competitive.

202491.name: The 12 Towers
202491.description:
--Introduction--

The 12 Towers is an RPG board game for 2-6 players. The objective is to take control of all. Active Towers, and/or eliminate the opposing players.
Players take the role of “Keepers”, powerful rulers that control a Tower, and its surrounding territory. Throughout the course of the game, Towers will be
gained, lost, or even destroyed. Controlling Towers will involve combat, diplomacy, and teamwork. However, it may also involve treachery and deception.

While the objectives of the game are clear, it is entirely up to the players to decide how they play the game individually. Some may be aggressive
and charge head on, while others might focus on defensive actions. In the end, when players interact, they are in complete control of their own fate.
Not only do you bring a strategy to the game, you bring your personality as well.

--Brief Overview of the game--

Players: 2-6
Game Type: PvP, RPG, Exploration, Board Control
Game Board: 32 x 32 Inch Dodecahedron (13 pieces)
Movement Style: Set space amount (Can be increased or decreased)

Game Components:
- 12 Keeper Figurines
- 12 Tower Figurines
- 12 Colored Die
- 576 Game Cards
- 6 Tracker Sheets
- 12 5x7 Tower Cards

Game Run Time:
Easy/2 Players - 30/60 Minutes
Medium/4 to 6 Players - 45/90 Minutes
Hard/8 to 12 Players - 120/180 Minutes

--Game Board--

The board for The 12 Towers uses a hexagon battle grid. Players can explore, battle, cast spells, set up walls and defensive structures, and even set traps.
There is no limitation to where you can go, or what you can do. It is important to know what the different colored spaces and regions do.
Remember, the rules are for a standard game, and players have the freedom to alter these rules and regulations to better suit their needs.

--Towers--

Each Tower in the game has a unique theme, as well as it’s own strengths and weaknesses. Remember, it is important to explore options, and try out other Towers.
You may have a favorite Tower, or discover a useful combination that can turn the tides of battle, and become an intimidating force!

Your Tower is the home of your Keeper, and it’s surrounding territories belong to you and your citizens. Whether you’re the Brutal Orc King of the Fire Tower, or the
Undead Lord of the Black Tower, your Keeper is the King of it’s territory. As you play the game, you’ll gain control, or lose Towers.
Be sure to use strategy and planning when you take over the board.

--Power--

Power is the heart of The 12 Towers. Power is a simplified number that represents everything that you are; Health, Mana, Currency, Influence, everything.
Almost everything in the game effects Power. Whether you are taking damage from weapons, or casting spells. All players begin the game with the same amount of Power.
The standard starting amount is 2000. This number is them divided between your Keeper, and your starting Tower.
This number can be adjusted to use needs, or accommodate additional players.

--Cards--

The core version of The 12 Towers contains 576 cards. There are 2 types of cards; Items, and Events. Items are cards you can equip, use, cast and break.
Event cards are primarily used to give the players an advantage, as well as set the stage for role playing, and gives life and scenery to the game.
Events are the main source of gaining more item cards.

202493.description:
The Spoils: Decade of Deckadence is the next evolution in The Spoils card game, with this serving as both a standalone core set that is self-contained and a "cube" drafting set.

As a standalone core set, you can put together draft packs from the cards included, draft those cards, then play — or you can combine two decks to play in a sealed deck format or to build your own decks for the next VICTORS tournament.

As a “cube” drafting product, the purpose of DoD is to provide an easy entry point for new players with access to many of the most powerful cards in The Spoils history. Many of the cards in the DoD are extremely powerful!
202493.name: The Spoils: Decade of Deckadence

202494.description:
The year is 2078. The worlds’ megacorporations straddle the sprawls of the Sixth World, goliaths that intimidate even nations as they suck in souls in their drive for the almighty nuyen. Between the cracks, shadowrunners carve out a living as deniable and disposable assets that megacorps fire at each other for datasteals, personnel extractions, or even wetwork. Whether casting manabolts of magic, riding the electrons of the Matrix with just the brain, or slinging good, old-fashioned flying lead while firing at speed enhanced by the latest in bio-engineering, runners live dangerously and hope their skills are good enough to let them survive another day.

Encounters: Shadowrun is a 1-8 player fast-paced, pushed-your-luck dice and card game. Players take the role of Mr. Johnson, arranging the megacorps’ dirty work and adding new shadowrunners to their already-assembled teams. They send their teams into the shadows of the mean sprawl streets of the Sixth World, collecting though paydata to beat down their rivals. Grab some dice, make a team, and show ’em who’s the boss.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to acquire ¥30.
Each player starts the game with (1) runner and 6 dice. At the start of your turn you flip over location card, that has effects aka breaks the rules, on every turn until a new environment card comes into play. You then flip over the top Event card form the deck and try and roll an exact match of the number on the card. If you succeed you place a die on the. You could stop then and receive ¥1 or flip a card and continue to press your luck. If you fail the next player starts a new run with a chance to collect n the ¥ you forfeited.

¥ are used as victory points as well as currency to buy additional runners.
202494.name: Encounters: Shadowrun

202495.name: The Zombie Apocalypse Won't Just be Slow...
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202495.description:
From the introduction:

Zombies are untiring, fearless waves of mindless destruction. The proverbial horde of zombies shambling toward a village of innocent souls can bring horror to the stoutest of hearts. However... they’re really only dangerous in large numbers because, let’s face it, zombies are slow. But what if a zombie wasn’t slow? What if a zombie moved faster than you, caused multiple wounds, and could evade your attacks even better than when it was alive? The primitive horror of a mass of zombies could quickly turn to true terror from just one zombie.
Walking, climbing, swimming, flying, and burrowing into your homes, included here are 46 fast zombies from CR ½ to CR 11 with multiple attacks to cause even the most stalwart group of adventurers to quail in fear. Fast zombies don’t shamble, they run.

rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202496.name: 20 Encounters (The City Watch)
202496.description:
From the introduction:

By order of the King an Act Mandating The Watch. It is commandth that from henceforth all watches be made as it hath been used in past times by six men at every gate in every borough by twelve men in every town by six or four according to the number of inhabitants of the town. They shall keep the peace and if any stranger do pass them by them he shall be questioned or arrested until no suspicion is found and if no suspicion be found he shall go quit.

User summary:

Random tables to use with city watch encounters.

202497.name: Barbarian Character Portfolio
202497.description:
From the back of the book:

This is the ultimate Barbarian class character portfolio for the Pathfinder system. This 15 page portfolio includes all the class features, Rage Powers and plenty of room to create your character. This portfolio also includes 10 Alternate Archetype’s.

User summary:

A print-and-play accessory.

rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202498.name: Introduction to the Third Dawn Campaign Setting
202498.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Third Dawn Campaign Setting, a world of psionic power, swashbuckling action, and political intrigue, designed for the world’s most popular role-playing game. This product is somewhat unique in that it is truly an all psionic campaign setting. In the Third Dawn Campaign Setting, you will not find gods or goddesses; you will not find bards, clerics, druids, wizards, sorcerers, or paladins. Indeed, the Third Dawn Campaign Setting only has psionic and non-magical classes. Instead of the cleric, you can find the worldthought medic. In place of the wizard, you have the psion. And instead of the bard, you will find the thoughtsinger.

202499.name: The Wayfaring Guide To: Haven
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
202499.description:
From the introduction:

Have your players ever gone left when you really wanted them to go right? Have you ever watched the fighter huff and puff, bored to tears, while the wizard searches the city libraries for new spells? Have you ever found your characters entering a new town that you don’t really have prepared? You have most likely encountered these challenges in some variation. The Wayfaring Guides series is designed to help.
